title: Resolution to kill IRS DeFi broker rule heads to Trump’s desk
body: The US Senate has passed a resolution to kill a Biden administration-era rule to require decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols to report to the Internal Revenue Service, which will now head to US President Donald Trump’s desk. On March 26, the Senate voted 70-28 to pass a motion repealing the so-called IRS DeFi broker rule that aimed to expand existing IRS reporting requirements to crypto. The Senate had voted to pass the resolution earlier in March, which also passed the House, but it was sent back to the Senate for a final vote before it could be sent to Trump. The White House’s AI and crypto czar, David Sacks, has said Trump supports killing the rule . This is a developing story, and further information will be added as it becomes available.

title: Revolutionizing Telegram: How TON Blockchain Unlocks a Thriving In-App Economy
body: Exciting news is buzzing in the crypto world! Pavel Durov, the visionary founder of Telegram, has officially declared The Open Network (TON) as the powerhouse behind Telegram’s rapidly expanding in-app economy. This bold move signals a significant leap for crypto adoption within mainstream social platforms, and it’s poised to reshape how users interact and transact within the Telegram ecosystem. Let’s dive deep into what this means for you and the future of Telegram. Unveiling the Powerhouse: Telegram In-App Economy Fueled by TON In a recent announcement on X, Pavel Durov highlighted the pivotal role of TON in Telegram’s burgeoning in-app ecosystem. But what exactly does this entail? Essentially, TON is no longer just a separate blockchain project; it’s becoming deeply intertwined with the very fabric of Telegram, powering crucial functionalities that directly impact users, creators, and developers. This integration isn’t just incremental; it’s fundamental. Here’s a breakdown of how TON is becoming central to the Telegram in-app economy : Payments for Telegram Ads: Forget traditional payment methods! In most countries, if you’re looking to promote your channel or bot with Telegram Ads , TON is now the go-to for payments. This streamlines the advertising process and potentially opens up new avenues for businesses and creators to reach their target audiences within Telegram. Exclusive Withdrawal Method for Creators and Developers: For those building bots, creating content, or developing within the Telegram ecosystem, TON serves as the primary method for withdrawing earnings. This is a game-changer, offering a potentially faster and more efficient way to access revenue compared to traditional banking systems, especially for a global user base. Trading Telegram Assets via TON-based NFTs: Ever wanted to own a unique Telegram username? Or perhaps send a digital gift that truly stands out? TON underpins the trading of Telegram assets like usernames and digital gifts through NFTs . This introduces a new layer of digital ownership and scarcity within Telegram, leveraging the booming NFT space. Backbone for Telegram Mini Apps: Those engaging and interactive Telegram Mini Apps , used by hundreds of millions, are built entirely on TON. This signifies a massive scale of operation and trust in TON’s infrastructure to support a significant portion of Telegram’s user activity. Decoding the Technology: Why TON Blockchain is Telegram’s Choice Durov didn’t just randomly pick a blockchain. He specifically emphasized TON’s scalability as a crucial factor. In a world where blockchain networks often struggle with transaction speeds and high fees, TON stands out. But what makes the TON blockchain so special, and why is it the ideal fit for Telegram’s ambitious plans? Sharding for Scalability: TON utilizes a technique called sharding. Imagine dividing a massive database into smaller, more manageable parts. Sharding does something similar for the blockchain, allowing it to process transactions in parallel across multiple shards (sub-blockchains). This dramatically increases throughput and allows TON to handle a significantly larger volume of transactions compared to blockchains without sharding. Designed for Billions of Transactions: Durov explicitly mentioned TON’s potential to support billions of transactions. This isn’t just marketing hype; it’s a testament to TON’s architecture, which is built from the ground up to handle massive scale, aligning perfectly with Telegram’s ever-growing user base and transaction demands. Real Fundamental Value: In a crypto landscape often filled with projects lacking tangible utility, Durov boldly stated that TON is “one of the few blockchains with real fundamental value.” This endorsement from a tech leader like Durov carries significant weight and suggests that TON isn’t just about speculation; it’s about providing real-world utility and infrastructure. The choice of TON underscores Telegram’s commitment to building a robust and scalable in-app economy that can accommodate its massive global user base. It’s not just about adding crypto features; it’s about fundamentally rethinking how transactions and interactions happen within the platform. Pavel Durov’s Vision: A Decentralized Future for Telegram? Pavel Durov ‘s endorsement of TON goes beyond just technological integration; it hints at a broader vision for Telegram’s future. By embracing blockchain technology and decentralization, Telegram could be positioning itself as a leader in the next evolution of social platforms. What could this vision entail? Empowering Creators and Users: By using TON for payments and withdrawals, Telegram potentially empowers creators and users with more control over their earnings and digital assets. Decentralized systems can often reduce reliance on intermediaries and potentially lower fees, benefiting both creators and users. Building a Web3 Ecosystem within Telegram: The integration of NFTs and Mini Apps on TON suggests Telegram is building a mini-Web3 ecosystem within its platform. This could attract developers and entrepreneurs looking to leverage Telegram’s massive user base to build decentralized applications and services. Future Decentralization of Telegram Infrastructure? While not explicitly stated, the deep integration with TON raises questions about the potential for further decentralization of Telegram’s infrastructure in the future. Could we see aspects of Telegram itself, beyond just the in-app economy, becoming more decentralized and community-driven? Durov’s statements suggest a long-term commitment to TON and a belief in the power of blockchain to enhance Telegram’s ecosystem. This could mark a turning point, not just for Telegram, but for how social platforms integrate with cryptocurrency technologies. Streamlining Transactions: Telegram Crypto Payments Powered by TON One of the most immediate and impactful applications of TON is in Telegram crypto payments . The shift to TON for Telegram Ads payments and creator withdrawals is more than just a technical upgrade; it represents a fundamental shift in how value is exchanged within the Telegram ecosystem. Let’s explore the benefits and implications: Feature Traditional Systems TON-Powered Telegram Payments Payment Method for Telegram Ads Credit Cards, Bank Transfers, etc. TON Withdrawal Method for Creators Bank Transfers, Payment Processors TON Transaction Speed Varies, can be slow Potentially Faster Transaction Fees Can be higher Potentially Lower Accessibility May have geographical limitations Potentially more globally accessible By embracing TON for crypto payments, Telegram is potentially offering a more efficient, cost-effective, and globally accessible payment infrastructure. This is particularly beneficial for creators and businesses operating in regions with limited access to traditional financial systems. Scaling for the Future: Can TON Scalability Handle Telegram’s Growth? The question on everyone’s mind is: Can TON scalability truly handle the demands of Telegram’s massive and ever-growing user base? Durov’s confidence is reassuring, but let’s delve deeper into the technical aspects of TON’s scalability and its potential limitations: Theoretical Limits of Sharding: While sharding significantly enhances scalability, it’s not a silver bullet. There are theoretical limits to how much a blockchain can scale, even with sharding. However, TON’s architecture is designed to push these limits further than many other blockchains. Real-World Performance Under Load: The true test of scalability is real-world performance under heavy load. As Telegram’s in-app economy grows and transaction volumes increase, TON’s network will be continuously tested. Ongoing monitoring and optimization will be crucial to ensure smooth performance. Future Upgrades and Developments: Blockchain technology is constantly evolving. TON, like other blockchains, will likely undergo continuous upgrades and improvements to further enhance its scalability and performance over time. Staying adaptable and innovative is key to maintaining long-term scalability. While challenges may arise, TON’s sharding architecture and focus on scalability position it well to handle Telegram’s future growth. The integration is a bold bet on the future of blockchain technology and its ability to support mainstream applications at scale. Conclusion: Telegram and TON – A Powerful Partnership for the Future Pavel Durov’s announcement is a clear signal: TON is not just a side project; it’s the engine driving Telegram’s in-app economy and potentially shaping its future trajectory. From revolutionizing Telegram crypto payments to powering Telegram in-app economy , TON’s scalability and utility are being put to the test on a massive scale. Pavel Durov ‘s vision of a decentralized and efficient platform is taking shape, leveraging the power of the TON blockchain . This partnership is one to watch closely, as it could set a new precedent for how social platforms integrate with cryptocurrency and blockchain technology, unlocking a world of possibilities for users, creators, and the entire crypto ecosystem. title: Crucial Crypto Bills Update: Congress Nears Landmark Vote on Stablecoins & FIT 21
body: Are you ready for a potential seismic shift in the crypto landscape? Washington D.C. is buzzing with activity as Congress edges closer to making decisive moves on crypto bills and stablecoin bills . For crypto enthusiasts, investors, and industry players, this is a moment to watch closely. The future of digital assets in the US could be defined in the coming days as lawmakers work to establish a clear regulatory framework. Let’s dive into the details of these potentially groundbreaking developments. What’s the Buzz Around Crypto Bills in Congress? The momentum is building on Capitol Hill. Rep. French Hill, a key figure in these discussions, has indicated that a revised version of the highly anticipated FIT 21 bill will be unveiled within days. This is not just another piece of legislation; FIT 21 , or the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century Act, is designed to create a comprehensive market structure for the crypto industry. Think of it as a blueprint for how digital assets will be governed in the US. But what exactly does FIT 21 aim to achieve? Expanding CFTC Oversight: One of the core goals of FIT 21 is to broaden the authority of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC). This would mean the CFTC would have a greater role in overseeing the crypto market, particularly concerning digital commodities. Defining the SEC’s Role: Equally important is clarifying the Securities and Exchange Commission’s (SEC) jurisdiction. The bill seeks to delineate where the SEC’s regulatory perimeter ends and where the CFTC’s begins, aiming to eliminate the ambiguity that has plagued the industry. Clarity for Crypto Businesses: For crypto businesses operating in the US, this clarity is paramount. A well-defined regulatory landscape can foster innovation, encourage investment, and provide a stable environment for growth, reducing the fear of inadvertently crossing regulatory lines. Rep. Hill’s announcement signals that lawmakers are serious about advancing crypto regulation . The revised draft likely incorporates feedback and revisions from previous discussions, suggesting a collaborative effort to create a workable framework. Stablecoin Bills: Are We Nearing a Breakthrough? Parallel to the FIT 21 developments, significant progress is also being made on stablecoin bills . Rep. Bryan Steil has confirmed that the text of the House stablecoin bill is imminent, with a markup expected shortly after its introduction. This is a crucial step towards regulating stablecoins, which are cryptocurrencies designed to maintain a stable value, often pegged to fiat currencies like the US dollar. Why are stablecoin bills so important? Systemic Risk Mitigation: Stablecoins have grown exponentially in popularity and market capitalization. Their widespread use means that their stability (or instability) can have broader implications for the financial system. Regulation aims to mitigate potential systemic risks. Consumer Protection: Ensuring that stablecoins are backed by adequate reserves and operate transparently is crucial for consumer protection. Regulations can establish standards for reserves, auditing, and disclosure. Payment Innovation: Stablecoin bills can pave the way for the responsible innovation of stablecoins as payment mechanisms. Clear rules can encourage adoption while safeguarding against misuse. The fact that both House and Senate versions of the stablecoin bill are reportedly about 80% aligned is a very encouraging sign. This level of consensus suggests a strong bipartisan push to get stablecoin regulation across the finish line. Unified digital asset regulation appears to be a shared goal, transcending partisan lines. The Push for Unified Digital Asset Regulation The overarching narrative here is the drive towards unified digital asset regulation . Lawmakers are recognizing the need for a cohesive and comprehensive approach to governing cryptocurrencies and related technologies. Fragmented or conflicting regulations could stifle innovation and create unnecessary compliance burdens. A unified framework, on the other hand, can provide: Benefit Description Clarity and Certainty Businesses and investors gain a clear understanding of the rules of the game, reducing uncertainty and fostering confidence. Reduced Compliance Costs A unified framework can streamline compliance, making it less costly and complex for businesses to operate within the regulatory perimeter. Innovation and Growth Clear rules can encourage responsible innovation and attract investment, driving growth in the digital asset sector. Consumer Protection Unified standards can enhance consumer protection across the board, ensuring consistent safeguards. The alignment between House and Senate on stablecoin bills , coupled with the progress on FIT 21 , indicates a serious commitment to establishing this unified digital asset regulation . The reported 80% alignment is a significant leap forward, suggesting that major sticking points have been addressed or are close to resolution. What’s Next and Why Should You Care? The coming days and weeks are critical. Keep an eye out for: Release of the revised FIT 21 draft: This document will provide a detailed look at the proposed market structure for crypto and the specific roles of the CFTC and SEC. Introduction of the House stablecoin bill text: The specifics of this bill will reveal the proposed regulatory framework for stablecoins, including requirements for issuers and reserves. Markup sessions: These sessions will be crucial for understanding the debates and potential amendments to the bills as they move through the legislative process. For anyone involved or interested in the crypto space, these legislative developments are incredibly important. They have the potential to shape the future of crypto in the US and set a precedent for global digital asset regulation . Whether you’re an investor, a developer, or simply curious about crypto, staying informed about these crypto bills and stablecoin bills is essential. A Landmark Moment for Crypto Regulation? The convergence of progress on both FIT 21 and stablecoin bills signals a potentially landmark moment for crypto regulation in the United States. While challenges and debates undoubtedly remain, the momentum is undeniable. As Congress nears action, the crypto world watches with bated breath, hopeful that these legislative efforts will pave the way for a clear, balanced, and innovation-friendly regulatory future for digital assets. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Warning: Bitget CEO Exposes Hyperliquid FTX Threat After JELLY Incident
body: Is history about to repeat itself in the volatile world of cryptocurrency exchanges? The crypto community is buzzing after Bitget CEO Gracy Chen issued a stark warning about decentralized exchange (DEX) Hyperliquid. Chen publicly stated that Hyperliquid’s handling of a recent incident, known as the JELLY incident, bears an uncanny resemblance to the events leading up to the colossal FTX collapse. Could Hyperliquid be the next domino to fall in the crypto space? Let’s dive into the details of this developing crypto exchange controversy and understand what’s at stake for crypto users. Why is Bitget CEO Gracy Chen Sounding the Alarm on Hyperliquid? The core of the issue stems from what Bitget CEO Gracy Chen describes as Hyperliquid’s “immature, unethical, and unprofessional” response to the JELLY incident. In a series of posts on X (formerly Twitter), Chen didn’t mince words, suggesting that Hyperliquid’s actions not only caused financial losses for users but also severely damaged the exchange’s credibility. This is a significant accusation, especially considering Hyperliquid markets itself as an innovative decentralized exchange. Here’s a breakdown of Chen’s key concerns: Immature Handling of JELLY Incident: Chen criticized Hyperliquid’s approach to resolving the JELLY incident, implying a lack of transparency and user-centric solutions. User Losses: She highlighted that Hyperliquid’s actions resulted in tangible financial losses for users, a critical breach of trust in the crypto exchange environment. Damaged Credibility: According to Chen, the incident has significantly eroded Hyperliquid’s credibility, questioning its reliability and trustworthiness as a DEX platform. FTX 2.0 Potential: The most alarming aspect of Chen’s statement is the direct comparison to FTX, suggesting that the JELLY incident could be a precursor to a larger crisis at Hyperliquid, mirroring the catastrophic downfall of FTX. Chen’s commentary raises serious questions about the operational standards and user protection mechanisms within the decentralized exchange sector, particularly when compared to regulated centralized exchanges. Decentralized Exchange (DEX) vs. Centralized Exchange (CEX): Are User Funds Really Safer? The rise of decentralized exchange DEX platforms was largely fueled by the desire for greater user control and transparency, contrasting sharply with the opaque nature of some centralized exchanges. DEXs, in theory, eliminate the need for intermediaries, allowing users to trade directly from their wallets. However, Chen’s critique throws a spotlight on the potential pitfalls even within the DEX space. Let’s compare DEXs and CEXs in light of this controversy: Feature Decentralized Exchange (DEX) Centralized Exchange (CEX) Custody of Funds Users retain control of their private keys and funds. Users deposit funds into the exchange’s custody. Transparency Transactions are typically recorded on a public blockchain. Transparency can vary; some CEXs are less transparent about their operations. Regulation & Compliance Often operates with less regulatory oversight. Subject to regulations and KYC/AML compliance. Risk of Incidents Smart contract vulnerabilities, protocol risks, operational immaturity. Exchange hacks, mismanagement, regulatory risks. User Protection User protection mechanisms can be less defined and harder to enforce. Often have established customer support and some level of regulatory protection (depending on jurisdiction). Chen’s statement suggests that while DEXs offer the promise of decentralization, they are not immune to operational failures and user harm. Her comparison of Hyperliquid to “offshore centralized exchanges that facilitate illegal activities without KYC/AML” is particularly damning. It implies that Hyperliquid, despite being a DEX, might be exhibiting similar risky behaviors and lack of accountability that contributed to the FTX debacle. The JELLY Incident Crypto: What Actually Happened? To understand the gravity of the JELLY incident crypto controversy, it’s crucial to know what transpired. While specific details of the JELLY incident require further investigation and official statements from Hyperliquid, the core issue seems to revolve around a significant operational or technical glitch that led to user losses. Based on available information and Chen’s comments, the JELLY incident likely involved: A Technical Issue: Potentially a smart contract vulnerability, a platform bug, or an exploit that affected trading or asset management on Hyperliquid. User Losses: This technical issue resulted in direct financial losses for users who were trading or holding assets on the platform at the time of the incident. Hyperliquid’s Response: Chen’s criticism focuses on how Hyperliquid handled the aftermath – allegedly in an “immature, unethical, and unprofessional” manner, suggesting a lack of adequate communication, compensation, or resolution for affected users. The lack of detailed public information about the JELLY incident itself further fuels concerns about transparency and user protection within the DEX space. A robust and transparent response to such incidents is crucial for maintaining user trust and the long-term viability of any crypto exchange, whether centralized or decentralized. Hyperliquid FTX: Is History Repeating Itself? The most alarming takeaway from Bitget CEO’s statement is the direct comparison of Hyperliquid FTX . The collapse of FTX sent shockwaves through the crypto industry, exposing the dangers of centralized control, lack of transparency, and alleged fraudulent activities. Chen drawing parallels between Hyperliquid and FTX is a serious accusation that warrants attention and scrutiny. Why is the FTX comparison so potent and concerning? Sudden and Unexpected Collapse: FTX’s downfall was rapid and largely unexpected by many, highlighting how quickly trust can erode in the crypto space. User Fund Mismanagement: Allegations of FTX mismanaging and misusing user funds were central to its collapse, leading to massive user losses. Lack of Transparency and Accountability: FTX was criticized for its opaque operations and lack of accountability, contributing to the crisis. Industry-Wide Contagion: The FTX collapse had ripple effects across the crypto market, impacting numerous projects and investors. If Hyperliquid is indeed exhibiting similar patterns of questionable practices or inadequate user protection, as suggested by Chen, the potential for a similar catastrophic outcome cannot be dismissed lightly. The crypto community remembers the lessons of FTX, and any hint of history repeating itself is bound to trigger alarm bells. Actionable Insights: Protecting Yourself in the DEX Era This crypto exchange controversy serves as a crucial reminder for all crypto users, especially those venturing into the world of decentralized exchanges. While DEXs offer exciting possibilities, they also come with inherent risks. Here are some actionable insights to protect yourself: Due Diligence is Key: Thoroughly research any DEX platform before using it. Understand its operational model, security measures, and community reputation. Risk Diversification: Don’t put all your crypto assets on a single platform, especially a relatively new or less established DEX. Diversify across multiple platforms and cold storage solutions. Stay Informed: Keep abreast of news and developments related to the DEX platforms you use. Follow industry experts and monitor social media for any red flags or user concerns. Understand Smart Contract Risks: Be aware that DEXs rely on smart contracts, which can have vulnerabilities. Opt for platforms with audited and well-vetted smart contracts. Prioritize Transparency: Favor DEXs that are transparent about their operations, incident response protocols, and user protection mechanisms. The evolving landscape of crypto exchanges demands vigilance and informed decision-making. The Hyperliquid situation, highlighted by Bitget CEO Gracy Chen, underscores the importance of critical evaluation and risk management, even within the decentralized realm. Conclusion: A Stark Warning for the DEX Future? Bitget CEO Gracy Chen’s shocking allegations against Hyperliquid have ignited a crucial conversation about the state of decentralized exchanges and user safety. The comparison to FTX is a grave warning, urging both users and the industry to take a closer look at the operational practices and accountability mechanisms within the DEX sector. While decentralization offers numerous benefits, it doesn’t inherently guarantee safety or immunity from failures. The JELLY incident and its aftermath serve as a potent reminder that robust security, transparency, and user-centric responses are paramount for the sustained growth and trust in the decentralized crypto ecosystem. The crypto community will be watching closely to see how Hyperliquid responds to these serious accusations and what steps the broader DEX industry takes to ensure user protection and prevent potential “FTX 2.0” scenarios. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping crypto market price action.

title: Crypto Price Today: BTC, ETH, SOL, XRP, SHIB, DOGE, LINK, PEPE, ADA
body: Cryptocurrencies are swimming in a sea of red following a wave of market corrections across top assets. A glance at the charts reveals that crypto price today exhibits dour sentiments with BTC, ETH, SOL, and XRP in bleed mode. Crypto Price Today: Top Coins Suffers Are In The Red According to CoinMarketCap data , flagship cryptocurrency Bitcoin (BTC) has dipped by nearly 2% today to trade at $87,000, quelling enthusiasm for a run toward $90K. Bitcoin’s decline is pulling other assets underwater with the largest altcoin Ethereum down by 3.1% at just above $2,000. The fourth-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization has shed nearly 4% as it exchanges hands at $2.36. The asset has failed to rally following the dismissal of the Ripple SEC Case, wallowing at 38.27% from its all-time high of $3.84. Furthermore, Solana (SOL) has lost 5% of its value as it trades at $137. The sixth-largest token has erased previous gains despite rising institutional interest from Polymarket enabling SOL deposits and BlackRock’s BUIDL fund launching on the network. On the other hand, Cardano (ADA) is bleeding at $0.7, after shedding nearly 5% of its market capitalization in the correction. Predictions for ADA to $10 seem far off for the ninth-largest cryptocurrency with daily trading volumes of under $1 billion confirming widespread optimism. Chainlink (LINK) trades at $15.19 with a respectable 1.68% decline for the asset. Daily trading volumes of over 12% are signaling a potential upswing for LINK price in the near future. Memecoins Are Recording Impressive Gains While the rest of the market is bleeding memecoins are bucking the trend to notch upswing. Shiba Inu (SHIB) has surged by nearly 4% as it seeks to eliminate a zero from its present price. Dogecoin (DOGE) continues its upward trend, climbing by 2% to trade at $0.1945 on the heels of a Dogecoin Reserve . DOGE’s daily trading volume is matching the enthusiasm of price predictions touting the memecoin to embark on a strong rally. The biggest gainer of the lot is PEPE with its near 7% spike over the last day. The memecoin has a daily trading volume of $1 billion, a 96% jump over the last day as it eyes an increase in its market value. Despite the rallies, Ark Invest’s Cathie Wood says memecoins will lose value in the coming days. However, the memecoin rally was unable to stop the global market capitalization for crypto price today from sliding by 2% to settle at $2.84 trillion. title: Here’s Why March 27 Could Be Crucial For Ripple and XRP
body: On March 25, 2025, XRP enthusiast Zach Rector shared a post regarding the legal battle between the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Ripple. According to Rector, the SEC Commissioners will hold a vote on March 27 to finalize their decision to end the appeal against Ripple. He stated that an official announcement would follow soon after. This development comes after the SEC agreed to dismiss its appeal against Ripple, marking a significant moment for the cryptocurrency industry. The image attached to the Rector’s post showed a Sunshine Act notice for a closed SEC meeting scheduled for March 27, 2025. While the official agenda of this meeting has not been disclosed, the timing suggests it could include discussions related to the Ripple case. According to Rector, the first hearing to confirm Paul Atkins as the new SEC Chair will happen the same day. XRP Case Conclusion Prediction On Thursday March 27th the SEC Commissioners will conduct the “official” vote to end their appeal against Ripple. Official announcement will follow shortly. This very same day we have the first hearing to confirm incoming Chair of the SEC Paul… pic.twitter.com/hmfXwZGPPT — Zach Rector (@ZachRector7) March 24, 2025 The End of the SEC’s Battle Against Ripple The lawsuit between the SEC and Ripple has been ongoing since December 2020, when the SEC accused Ripple of conducting an unregistered securities offering through its XRP token sales. Over the years, the case has seen multiple notable rulings, including Judge Analisa Torres’s 2023 decision that XRP was not a security in secondary sales and the August 2024 ruling that imposed a $125 million penalty on the company. The SEC’s subsequent appeal attempts have not changed any of these rulings, and the regulator’s decision to drop the appeal follows recent dismissals of other crypto-related lawsuits and investigations. This dismissal would mark a major victory for Ripple and the broader cryptocurrency industry, and the results could be a notable precedent for digital asset regulation. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 The SEC Meeting and Possible Announcement The SEC’s Sunshine Act notice confirms that a closed meeting will occur on March 27, 2025, at 2:00 p.m. ET. While the notice does not specify the topics under discussion, Rector and others in the cryptocurrency community speculate that the formal vote to end the Ripple appeal could be included. If the vote occurs as expected, an official announcement could follow. This dismissal is a major step toward the future. It coincides with the confirmation hearing of Paul Atkins, the man Donald Trump has nominated to bring the SEC into a new era of proper regulatory practices. The timing of this meeting, combined with the recent lawsuit dismissals , raises expectations that the Ripple lawsuit’s resolution could be confirmed soon. title: Congress Moves Fast on Stablecoin Regulation: House Unveils New Bill After Senate Approval
body: The post Congress Moves Fast on Stablecoin Regulation: House Unveils New Bill After Senate Approval appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Congress is taking swift action to shape the future of stablecoins in the crypto world. The House of Representatives just released its version, following the Senate’s recent approval of a similar bill. New Bill to Align House and Senate Efforts This new legislation will set rules for how companies can create and use digital tokens backed by the U.S. dollar, marking a major step in bringing more oversight and clarity to the growing crypto industry. Steil explained that the new version of the bill will help align the House and Senate’s efforts, making the two versions more similar and easier to work with. The Stablecoin Transparency and Accountability for a Better Ledger Economy (STABLE Act) “is a strong continuation of our work on digital assets in the last Congress,” Hill said in a statement. Rep Emmer Reintroduces Securities Clarity Act Besides, on Wednesday, Rep. Emmer reintroduced his Securities Clarity Act , aiming to clarify how crypto assets fit into securities law. “Until we have a clear definition of what is a commodity and what is a security, American innovation will continue to suffer. Our legislation will help provide these answers and allow American investors to fully participate in digital asset technology without sacrificing consumer protections,” Congressman Tom Emmer noted. As the conference came to an end, the Senate held a second vote to overturn the IRS’ 2024 rule on DeFi brokers, after both the Senate and House passed the resolution before. The vote passed with 70 Senators in favor and 28 against. Amanda Tuminelli, Executive Director of the DeFi Education Fund, thanked the bipartisan lawmakers who supported the resolution, pointing out the negative effects of the IRS’ rule on the DeFi industry. French Hill to Release Revised FIT 21 Bill Shortly At the DC Blockchain Summit on Wednesday, House Financial Services Committee Chair French Hill also mentioned that a revised version of the market structure bill is almost ready, following work from his committee last year. The bill, called FIT 21 (Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century Act), passed the House last year with support from 71 Democrats, including former Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Hill plans to release a revised draft in the next few weeks, after receiving “technical assistance.” The market structure bill from last year aimed to give the Commodity Futures Trading Commission more control over crypto markets, especially bitcoin, and clarify the SEC’s role. Passing the market structure bill is more challenging than the stablecoin legislation due to its complexity. When FIT 21 passed the House, it was influenced by opposition to former SEC Chair Gary Gensler and former President Joe Biden, leading to some compromises. However, now, with a different political landscape, those compromises may no longer be needed. Stablecoin Regulation Picking Up The Senate Banking Committee recently advanced the bipartisan GENIUS Act, which aims to establish a framework for regulating stablecoins and determining when issuers fall under state or federal oversight. Some Democrats voiced concerns and sought changes, but they were unsuccessful. Meanwhile, in the House, Republicans, led by Rep. Bryan Steil, introduced the STABLE Act in February to regulate stablecoins.

title: Urgent Alert: Trump’s Shock Auto Tariff Announcement – Crypto Market Braces for Impact
body: Buckle up, crypto enthusiasts! The global markets are on edge as former President Donald Trump is set to make a significant announcement regarding auto tariffs tonight at 8 p.m. UTC. While it might seem distant from the world of digital currencies, this move could send ripples through the entire financial ecosystem, potentially creating both challenges and opportunities for the crypto market. Let’s dive into what this Trump trade policy shift means and how it could affect your crypto portfolio. Why Auto Tariffs Matter to Crypto: Understanding the Economic Uncertainty At first glance, auto tariffs might seem like they only concern the automotive industry. However, in today’s interconnected global economy, such decisions have far-reaching consequences. Tariffs are essentially taxes on imported goods, designed to protect domestic industries. But they can also: Increase Consumer Prices: Tariffs can lead to higher prices for imported cars and potentially domestically produced cars as well, contributing to inflation. Spark Trade Wars: Imposing tariffs can provoke retaliatory measures from other countries, escalating into full-blown trade wars. This creates global trade tensions and economic instability. Impact Global Growth: Trade wars disrupt supply chains, reduce international trade, and can slow down global economic growth. Currency Fluctuations: Tariffs can influence currency exchange rates, impacting the value of the US dollar and other currencies, which in turn can affect crypto prices. For the crypto market, which often thrives on economic uncertainty crypto and volatility, these broader economic shifts are crucial to watch. When traditional markets face turbulence, investors sometimes look to alternative assets like Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies as hedges. Decoding Trump’s Auto Tariff Announcement: What to Expect? While the exact details of President Trump’s announcement are still under wraps, the anticipation itself is causing jitters in financial markets. Here’s what we can anticipate and consider: Scope of Tariffs: Will these tariffs be targeted at specific countries, or will they be broad-based? The scope will determine the extent of the impact. Tariff Rates: The percentage of tariffs imposed will directly influence the price increases and the level of trade disruption. Retaliation Risk: We need to assess the likelihood and potential scale of retaliatory tariffs from other nations. This could amplify global trade tensions . Market Reaction: How will stock markets, bond markets, and currency markets react immediately after the announcement? This initial reaction can give us clues about the potential impact on crypto. Navigating Market Volatility Crypto: Opportunities and Challenges The expected market volatility crypto markets might experience due to the tariff announcement presents a double-edged sword. Here’s a breakdown of potential scenarios: Scenario Potential Crypto Market Impact Opportunities Challenges Increased Economic Uncertainty Investors may seek safe-haven assets, potentially driving capital into Bitcoin and other established cryptocurrencies. Potential for price appreciation in major cryptocurrencies. Increased trading volume and market activity. Altcoins might experience higher volatility and increased risk. Regulatory uncertainty could be amplified during economic turmoil. Stock Market Downturn If auto tariffs trigger a significant stock market correction, some investors might diversify into crypto as an alternative investment. Opportunity to buy crypto at potentially lower prices if a market dip occurs. Increased awareness of crypto as a non-correlated asset. Broader market panic could temporarily drag down all asset classes, including crypto. Liquidity issues might arise in highly volatile conditions. Dollar Weakness Tariffs could weaken the US dollar if they negatively impact the US economy. A weaker dollar can historically be positive for Bitcoin. Bitcoin, often seen as an alternative to fiat currencies, could become more attractive. Dollar-pegged stablecoins might see increased scrutiny. Importing goods and services using crypto might become more expensive if the dollar weakens significantly against other currencies. Actionable Insights: Preparing Your Crypto Strategy Given the impending announcement and potential market volatility crypto could face, here are some actionable steps for crypto investors: Stay Informed: Keep a close watch on news related to the tariff announcement and its immediate aftermath. Monitor market reactions across different asset classes. Diversify Your Portfolio: Don’t put all your eggs in one basket. Diversification across different cryptocurrencies and potentially other asset classes can help mitigate risk. Manage Risk: Consider reducing leverage and setting stop-loss orders to protect your capital during periods of high volatility. Long-Term Perspective: Remember that short-term market fluctuations are common. Focus on the long-term fundamentals of your crypto investments. Explore Stablecoins: In times of uncertainty, stablecoins pegged to stronger currencies (other than USD if it weakens) could offer a temporary safe haven within the crypto ecosystem. The Bottom Line: Navigating the Trade Winds in Crypto President Trump’s auto tariff announcement is more than just trade policy; it’s a potential catalyst for economic shifts that can significantly impact the cryptocurrency market. By understanding the potential consequences of this Trump trade policy and preparing for increased market volatility crypto markets might experience, you can navigate these uncertain times strategically. Whether it presents opportunities for growth or challenges to overcome, staying informed and adaptable is key in the ever-evolving world of crypto. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Senator Elizabeth Warren says Trump will fire Fed chair Powell
body: Elizabeth Warren said on Wednesday that Trump plans to remove Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell from his post, calling it part of a purge that could rattle financial markets and blow up the idea of independent oversight in government. In an interview with Bloomberg Television, Elizabeth, who represents Massachusetts in the Senate, said, “Nobody is safe, not even the chairman of the Federal Reserve,” and warned that Trump’s interpretation of executive power means “all the power belongs to the king.” Elizabeth made the statement in Washington, D.C., just hours after Powell met with Treasury and Fed officials on the inflation trajectory. She accused Trump of overstepping legal limits to fire officials from independent agencies, including the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, which Elizabeth helped set up after the 2008 crash. “If he can just mow through every civil servant,” she said, “it’s a form of lawlessness.” She believes the president’s actions violate federal law. Warren hits Powell’s record and calls out Musk’s mass firings Elizabeth reminded Bloomberg that she had opposed Powell’s reappointment by former president Joe Biden, pointing to Powell’s support for loosening financial rules. She accused Powell of siding with Wall Street interests and warned that deregulating the banking sector would eventually hurt everyday people. Still, she said she supported the Fed’s independence and that of agencies like the Federal Trade Commission and Inspectors General, who have all been targeted under Trump’s return to power. During the same interview, Elizabeth called out Trump and Elon Musk for firing massive numbers of federal workers and terminating government contracts. She called it “lawlessness” and said it could destabilize the system designed to protect both markets and workers. She added that cutting rules that protect investors would wreck confidence in U.S. markets, saying, “The reason our stock market is so valuable is in part because it has level, transparent rules that are strictly enforced.” She also targeted Paul Atkins, who Trump wants to install as the new chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission. Elizabeth blamed Paul for voting in favor of weaker regulations before the financial crash of 2008 and said he hadn’t learned anything since then. “He had the chance to have 20-20 hindsight,” she said. “He has 20-zero hindsight.” Elizabeth, one of the Senate’s most outspoken progressives, also took aim at Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer for backing down on a procedural move that could have blocked a Republican spending bill earlier this month. That bill kept the government open, but many Democrats wanted to use the moment to push back against Musk’s federal firings. Elizabeth said: “I think there’s a moment when you stand and fight. We cannot avoid this fight, because Donald Trump and Elon Musk, truly they want to take this country over for just a handful of people and they want even more wealth and power to go to them while everybody else has to pay for it.” Bostic cuts forecast as tariffs drag inflation outlook While the political fights played out in Washington, Raphael Bostic, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta, appeared on Monday in a Bloomberg interview and lowered his rate-cut forecast. Earlier this year, Raphael had expected two rate cuts in 2025. Now he’s predicting just one, citing Trump’s tariffs as the key reason. “I moved to one mainly because I think we’re going to see inflation be very bumpy and not move dramatically and in a clear way to the 2% target,” he said. Raphael now expects inflation to settle around the Fed’s 2% target sometime in early 2027, which is even later than the Fed’s own projection in September 2024, when officials thought 2026 was more realistic. This adjustment aligns with the Fed’s most recent forecast, issued last week. Despite Raphael’s cautious tone, the Fed still says it sees a half-point rate cut coming this year, which would mean two reductions of 25 basis points. But that number is just the median. A closer look shows that more officials now expect either one cut or none at all next year. Trump demands immediate rate cuts as Powell hesitates Trump, meanwhile, wants rate cuts now. During a Cabinet meeting at the White House this week, he said, “Generally, prices are coming down, and energy prices are coming down, and I hope the Fed lowers interest rates, and then you get to see interest rates coming down.” Last week, he also posted online that the Fed should start slashing now before his new tariffs kick in on April 2. Those tariffs are already affecting the Fed’s inflation models, according to Jerome Powell, who acknowledged that rising trade costs are being considered in their economic forecasts. But the Fed isn’t moving just yet. Officials are still waiting for more data, even though investors are growing restless. The Fed’s latest inflation report showed slower price increases for both consumer and producer goods in February, but deeper numbers suggest the central bank’s 2% inflation goal could be delayed. The biggest problem is Trump’s trade policy, which throws uncertainty into every model Powell’s team is working with. Rick Rieder, Chief Investment Officer for Global Fixed Income at BlackRock, said on Wednesday, “Uncertainty was a highlight of the statement.” He explained that both the market and the Fed are stuck in limbo and need time to figure out what to do next. Powell told reporters that the Fed has to stick with earlier projections for now, saying, “There is a level of inertia” until more clarity emerges. But time might be running out, especially if Trump’s tariff policies escalate through the summer. There’s also concern that the Fed might cut rates for the wrong reason — not because inflation is easing, but because growth is slowing and the job market is weakening. That would signal weakness, not strength, and investors may not like what comes next. Ken Mahoney, CEO of Mahoney Asset Management, told Yahoo Finance on Thursday: “Everybody wants two cuts, three cuts, four cuts. You don’t want any cuts. You want earnings growth. You want a strong economy. Be careful what you wish for.” Even though Powell has held a more hawkish line, markets still priced in three rate cuts by the end of this year, up from two. That shift was reported by Bloomberg, based on traders reacting to the latest projections. But Ross Mayfield, investment strategist at Baird, warned that none of it might play out as expected. He said the Fed’s forecast models — especially the dot plot — haven’t exactly nailed it over the last five years. “The ‘dot plot’ and [the Fed’s] projections have not been super reliable over the last five years,” he said. He pointed to political chaos and economic confusion as reasons not to trust the numbers. “When the path forward is so unclear,” Ross said, “you just take it with a grain of salt, go back to basics, and focus on the drivers of either the individual equities or the sectors in the market that you own. In this case, thinking about things like earnings and long rates, rather than what the Fed is doing at the short end of the curve.” Cryptopolitan Academy: Tired of market swings? Learn how DeFi can help you build steady passive income. Register Now

title: Evolving Trend: Global Banks’ Crypto Holdings Witness Significant Decline Amid ETF Surge
body: Are you wondering what’s happening with banks and crypto? Recent data reveals a noteworthy shift in the digital asset landscape. As cryptocurrency exchange-traded funds (ETFs) gain popularity, global banks are seemingly adjusting their strategies, leading to a decrease in their direct cryptocurrency holdings. Let’s dive into this intriguing development and understand what it means for the future of finance and crypto. Why are Global Banks’ Crypto Holdings Declining? The ETF Effect The primary driver behind this shift appears to be the rise of crypto ETFs impact . These investment vehicles offer a regulated and perhaps more palatable way for institutional investors, including banks, to gain exposure to cryptocurrencies without directly holding the underlying assets. Instead of managing the complexities and security risks associated with direct spot cryptocurrency holdings , banks can now invest in ETFs that track the performance of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. Consider these points to understand the ETF effect: Ease of Access: ETFs are traded on traditional stock exchanges, making them easily accessible through existing brokerage accounts. This simplifies the investment process for banks accustomed to traditional financial instruments. Regulatory Comfort: Regulated ETFs provide a layer of compliance and oversight that might be more comfortable for risk-averse institutions like banks, especially compared to the often-murky waters of direct crypto custody. Diversification within Crypto: Crypto ETFs can offer diversified exposure to the crypto market, reducing the risk associated with holding individual cryptocurrencies. Liquidity: ETFs offer high liquidity, allowing banks to easily buy and sell their crypto exposure as needed, which might be less straightforward with direct cryptocurrency holdings. The Numbers Speak: A Snapshot of Banks’ Crypto Holdings Decline According to a CoinDesk report, citing data from the Basel Committee crypto on Banking Supervision (BCBS), the numbers clearly illustrate this downward trend. In the second quarter of 2024, an estimated 29 banks worldwide held $368.3 billion in cryptocurrencies. While this figure might seem substantial, it’s crucial to look at it in context. The proportion of spot cryptocurrency holdings within these banks’ overall assets is currently less than 3%. This figure represents a significant decline when compared to earlier periods, although specific historical data for direct comparison within the article is limited. To put this in perspective, let’s consider the BCBS’s recommendation: BCBS Recommendation: Back in December 2022, the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision advised that banks’ spot cryptocurrency holdings should ideally not exceed 2% of their total assets. Current Status: While the current proportion is “less than 3%”, it’s important to note that it’s still slightly above the recommended threshold from 2022. However, the direction of travel is clearly downwards, indicating banks are actively managing their direct crypto exposure. The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS) and Regulatory Influence The Basel Committee crypto on Banking Supervision plays a pivotal role in setting global standards for the regulation of banks. Their recommendations, although not legally binding in every jurisdiction, carry significant weight and influence how global banks crypto approach digital assets. Key aspects of BCBS’s influence include: Risk Management Framework: BCBS provides guidelines for banks to assess and manage the risks associated with crypto assets. This framework encourages a cautious approach, particularly towards volatile assets like cryptocurrencies. Capital Requirements: The committee’s recommendations often include guidelines on capital requirements for banks holding crypto assets. Higher capital requirements can make holding certain crypto assets less attractive from a capital efficiency perspective. Promoting Stability: BCBS’s primary objective is to enhance financial stability globally. Their cautious stance on direct banks crypto holdings decline reflects a broader concern about the potential risks that cryptocurrencies could pose to the traditional banking system. Guidance Evolution: It’s important to note that the regulatory landscape is constantly evolving. As the crypto market matures and becomes more integrated with traditional finance, BCBS’s guidance and recommendations are likely to adapt as well. What Does This Trend Mean for the Future of Crypto and Banks? The observed banks crypto holdings decline , coupled with the rise of crypto ETFs, signals an evolving trend in how traditional financial institutions are engaging with the cryptocurrency space. It’s not necessarily a retreat from crypto, but rather a strategic shift towards potentially less risky and more regulatory-compliant avenues for exposure. Here’s a look at the potential implications: Mainstream Adoption via ETFs: Crypto ETFs could become a primary vehicle for mainstream and institutional crypto adoption, channeling investment through regulated and familiar structures. Shift in Bank Strategy: Banks might focus more on offering crypto-related services, such as custody solutions for ETFs or advisory services, rather than directly holding large amounts of volatile cryptocurrencies on their balance sheets. Regulatory Clarity and Growth: As regulations surrounding crypto ETFs and digital assets become clearer globally, we could see further growth in these regulated crypto investment products. Continued Bank Interest in Blockchain: While direct crypto holdings might decrease, banks’ interest in blockchain technology and its applications is likely to remain strong, as they explore use cases beyond just cryptocurrency investments. Conclusion: Navigating the Evolving Crypto-Banking Landscape The data indicating a decline in global banks crypto direct holdings is a significant development, highlighting the dynamic interplay between traditional finance and the burgeoning cryptocurrency market. The surge in popularity of crypto ETFs impact appears to be a key catalyst, offering banks a different, potentially more palatable route to participate in the crypto space. As the regulatory landscape continues to mature and crypto ETFs gain further traction, it will be fascinating to observe how banks crypto holdings decline trend evolves and shapes the future of institutional crypto adoption. This isn’t necessarily a bearish signal for crypto; instead, it may represent a strategic recalibration as banks navigate the complexities and opportunities presented by digital assets in a rapidly changing financial world. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum institutional adoption.

title: Urgent Call: Crypto Firms Demand DOJ Clarity on Money Transmitter Rules
body: Is the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) casting a shadow over the future of crypto innovation? Over 30 leading crypto firms are raising serious concerns about the DOJ’s interpretation of money transmitter rules, arguing it could stifle development and push innovation overseas. Let’s dive into why these companies are ringing alarm bells and what it means for the future of decentralized finance (DeFi). Why are Crypto Firms Calling for DOJ Clarity on Money Transmitter Rules? At the heart of the issue is Section 1960, a statute designed to combat illegal money transmitting. While its original intent is clear, crypto firms argue that the DOJ is applying an overly broad interpretation, particularly in cases like the recent Tornado Cash sanctions. This broad interpretation, spearheaded by the DOJ, is seen as a significant departure from established FinCEN (Financial Crimes Enforcement Network) guidelines, creating a murky legal landscape for developers, especially those working on non-custodial software. Here’s a breakdown of the key concerns: Threat to Non-Custodial Software: The DOJ’s stance is perceived as a direct threat to developers of non-custodial software. Non-custodial software is crucial for DeFi, empowering users to maintain control of their own digital assets. If developers are deemed money transmitters simply for creating and distributing this software, it could severely hamper innovation. Bypassing FinCEN Guidance: FinCEN is the primary regulatory body for money transmission in the U.S. The crypto industry feels the DOJ is bypassing FinCEN’s more nuanced approach, creating regulatory confusion and uncertainty. Legal Uncertainty and Innovation Chill: The lack of legal clarity is creating a chilling effect. Firms are hesitant to invest and innovate in the U.S. when the legal boundaries are unclear and potentially punitive. This could lead to an exodus of crypto talent and development to more welcoming jurisdictions. In a strongly worded letter to Congress, spearheaded by the DeFi Education Fund, these crypto firms are urging lawmakers to step in and provide much-needed clarification. They are seeking a clear legislative intent that explicitly protects U.S.-based crypto and DeFi development from overly aggressive interpretations of money transmitter laws. The Tornado Cash Case: A Lightning Rod for Concerns The Tornado Cash saga is a prime example of why the industry is so concerned. Tornado Cash, a decentralized privacy tool, was sanctioned by the U.S. Treasury Department, with implications extending to developers who contributed to its code. The DOJ’s approach in this case has been interpreted by many as equating software code with money transmission itself. This is a dangerous precedent, according to industry experts, as it could criminalize the very act of writing and sharing open-source code. What are the Potential Ramifications of Vague DOJ Money Transmitter Rules? The consequences of the DOJ’s broad interpretation of DOJ money transmitter rules could be far-reaching and detrimental to the U.S. crypto industry. Let’s consider some potential outcomes: Ramification Description Innovation Stifled Fear of prosecution could discourage developers from building and deploying innovative DeFi applications and non-custodial tools within the U.S. Brain Drain Crypto talent and businesses may relocate to countries with clearer and more favorable regulatory frameworks, diminishing the U.S.’s position in the global crypto landscape. Reduced Competitiveness U.S.-based crypto firms could become less competitive compared to their international counterparts operating in more innovation-friendly environments. Hindered DeFi Growth The development and adoption of DeFi, a sector with immense potential for financial inclusion and innovation, could be significantly hampered. The Call for Action: Seeking Legislative Solutions for Legal Clarity The crypto industry’s plea is clear: they need Congress to step in and provide legal clarity . This isn’t just about protecting crypto firms ; it’s about fostering innovation, ensuring the U.S. remains a leader in technological advancement, and allowing the responsible growth of the digital asset ecosystem. The letter to Congress is a proactive step, urging lawmakers to: Clarify Legislative Intent: Explicitly define the scope of Section 1960 to ensure it doesn’t inadvertently target software developers and non-custodial technology providers. Reinforce FinCEN’s Role: Reaffirm FinCEN as the primary regulatory authority for money transmission within the crypto space, ensuring a consistent and expert-led approach. Promote Innovation-Friendly Regulation: Develop a regulatory framework that balances consumer protection and compliance with the need to encourage innovation and technological progress in the crypto sector. What’s Next? The Path to Regulatory Certainty for Crypto and DeFi The coming months will be crucial. Will Congress heed the call from crypto firms and take action to provide the necessary legal clarity ? The response will not only shape the future of the U.S. crypto industry but also send a powerful message about the nation’s commitment to innovation and technological leadership. The industry is watching closely, hoping for a positive resolution that fosters growth and ensures the U.S. remains at the forefront of the digital asset revolution. The demand for DOJ money transmitter rules clarification is not just about compliance; it’s about creating an environment where innovation can flourish, where developers feel safe to build, and where the U.S. can harness the transformative potential of crypto and DeFi. The stakes are high, and the need for action is urgent. To learn more about the latest crypto regulation trends, explore our article on key developments shaping crypto policy landscape.

title: Bitcoin Whales Make Big Moves As Bullish Momentum Resurfaces
body: On-chain data suggests that Bitcoin (BTC) whales – cryptocurrency wallets holding significant BTC amounts – have resumed accumulation after a brief period of dormancy. Bitcoin Accumulation Rises Among Whales In an X post published today, seasoned crypto analyst Ali Martinez highlighted a notable increase in BTC whale activity. He shared the following chart showing that 48 new wallets now hold 100 or more BTC. A surge in whale accumulation often signals rising confidence in Bitcoin’s long-term value. The leading digital asset has climbed over 15% from its March 10 low of approximately $76,600. As of writing, BTC is trading in the high $80,000s. Related Reading: Bitcoin Surge Fueled by $32B in Open Interest—Here’s What Could Happen Next Renewed optimism around BTC’s price trajectory stems from several recent macroeconomic developments, including cooler than expected Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation data for February and reports of US President Donald Trump adopting a softer stance on retaliatory tariffs scheduled to go into effect from April 2. On-chain intelligence firm Arkham reported long-dormant BTC whales becoming active again. In an X post, the firm highlighted how a wallet that held $3 million worth of BTC in 2017, recently became active after 8 years, with its holdings now valued at close to $250 million. Fellow crypto analyst Crypto Rover shared the following chart, illustrating a sharp rise in whale accumulation since late 2024. It is worth noting that the data excludes wallets tied to non-US exchanges and US Spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs). Is BTC Eyeing A New Record High? Several crypto analysts believe BTC may have already bottomed out this cycle and entered a new bullish phase, potentially setting the stage for a fresh all-time high (ATH). Related Reading: Bitcoin’s Bullish Pattern Returns – Is A Massive Uptrend Imminent? Noted crypto entrepreneur and former BitMEX CEO Arthur Hayes recently suggested that BTC ‘probably’ hit this cycle’s bottom during the March 10 dip to $76,600. Hayes added that while bottom may be in for BTC, stocks could still face further downside. Momentum indicators – such as the Relative Strength Index (RSI) – also appear bullish. Bitcoin’s daily RSI recently broke out of a multi-month downtrend, fuelling hopes of sustained upward momentum. Additionally, Martinez projected that BTC could surge to $112,000 if it decisively breaks the $94,000 resistance level. However, a drop below $76,000 could open the door to a deeper decline, potentially falling to $58,000. Moreover, in their latest investor memo, digital asset management firm Bitwise hinted that on a risk-adjusted basis, now could be an opportune time to buy BTC. As of press time, BTC is trading at $88,069, up 1% in the last 24 hours. Featured image from Unsplash, charts from X and TradingView.com

title: Shocking Leak: Chinese AI Censorship Machine Exposed
body: In the fast-paced world of cryptocurrency and digital freedom, the specter of censorship looms large. Imagine a world where even the subtlest dissent is flagged, where algorithms decide what you can and cannot see. This isn’t a dystopian fantasy; it’s the reality emerging from a massive data leak exposing China’s sophisticated AI Censorship Machine . Bitcoin World’s exclusive investigation reveals how China is supercharging its censorship capabilities using advanced AI, raising profound questions about digital rights and the future of online freedom globally. Are we on the brink of a new era of AI-powered authoritarianism? Let’s dive into the shocking details. Unveiling the Chinese AI Censorship Machine: A Data Leak Revelation A recently leaked database, uncovered by security researcher NetAskari and analyzed by Bitcoin World, paints a chilling picture of China’s escalating efforts to control online narratives. This isn’t just about blocking keywords like ‘Tiananmen Square’; it’s a leap into a new era of AI powered censorship . The data exposes a system trained on a staggering 133,000 examples of content deemed ‘sensitive’ by the Chinese government. What kind of content triggers these alarms? Social Unrest Indicators: Complaints about poverty, corruption, and labor disputes are flagged as ‘highest priority’. Political Satire: Even subtle jokes or historical analogies targeting current political figures are instantly flagged. Taiwan and Military Matters: Any mention of Taiwan politics, military movements, or weaponry is heavily scrutinized. Public Protests Triggers: Issues like pollution and food safety scandals, known to spark public demonstrations, are closely monitored. This isn’t just keyword filtering; this is a sophisticated LLM censorship China system designed to understand context and nuance, making it far more effective than traditional methods. Xiao Qiang, a UC Berkeley researcher specializing in Chinese censorship, confirms this, stating it’s “clear evidence” of the Chinese government using LLMs to enhance repression. He emphasizes the increased “efficiency and granularity of state-led information control” compared to human-labor-intensive methods. How Does This AI Censorship Machine Work? The leaked data reveals a system eerily similar to prompting ChatGPT. It tasks an unnamed Large Language Model (LLM) to assess content for sensitivity related to ‘politics, social life, and the military.’ Content deemed sensitive is flagged as ‘highest priority.’ The system’s creators are clearly leveraging the power of AI to automate and refine censorship at an unprecedented scale. Key Features of the AI Censorship System: Feature Description LLM Powered Utilizes a Large Language Model for content analysis, moving beyond simple keyword filtering. Extensive Training Data Trained on 133,000 examples of ‘sensitive’ content, ensuring comprehensive coverage. Prioritization Ranks flagged content by priority, focusing on ‘highest priority’ items for immediate action. Proactive Detection Aims to detect subtle dissent and nuanced criticism, not just blatant violations. The system’s goal, according to the data, is for ‘public opinion work’ – a term experts identify as Chinese government jargon for censorship and propaganda. Michael Caster from Article 19 explains this ‘public opinion work’ is managed by the Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC), with the aim of enforcing government narratives online and eliminating dissenting voices. President Xi Jinping himself has called the internet the “frontline” of this ‘public opinion work.’ Examples of Censored Content: Glimpse into the Database Bitcoin World analyzed representative samples from the 133,000 data points, revealing the breadth of content targeted by this Chinese AI Censorship system. These examples provide a stark look at what the Chinese government deems unacceptable for public consumption: Rural Poverty: Posts lamenting the decline of rural Chinese towns and the struggles of remaining residents. Local Corruption: Complaints from business owners about police extortion and corruption. CCP Corruption: News reports about Communist Party officials expelled for corruption and ‘superstitions’. Taiwan Military Analysis: Commentary on Taiwan’s military capabilities and Chinese military developments. Subtle Political Criticism: Anecdotes using idioms to indirectly criticize power dynamics and political transitions. The sheer volume of mentions of ‘Taiwan’ (台湾) – over 15,000 times – highlights the extreme sensitivity surrounding this topic. Even subtle forms of dissent, like using idioms to comment on power transitions, are targeted, demonstrating the system’s sophistication and reach. The Broader Implications: AI Censorship Globally This leak isn’t just about China. It’s a warning sign for digital freedom worldwide. The adoption of AI Censorship Machine technology by authoritarian regimes is accelerating. OpenAI itself reported catching Chinese entities using LLMs to track and smear dissidents. This trend signifies a dangerous shift towards more efficient and pervasive digital repression. Key Takeaways: Escalating AI Repression: Authoritarian governments are rapidly adopting AI to enhance censorship and surveillance. Beyond Keyword Blocking: AI-powered censorship is far more sophisticated, capable of understanding context and nuance. Global Implications: This technology could be exported and adopted by other regimes, further shrinking digital freedom. Urgent Need for Scrutiny: We must critically examine the ethical and human rights implications of AI-driven censorship. The Future of Digital Freedom: Fighting Back Against AI Censorship As China AI Surveillance capabilities grow, so too must our vigilance and efforts to protect digital freedom. Understanding how these AI censorship systems operate is the first step. Supporting organizations that fight for online freedom and privacy is crucial. The fight for a free and open internet is becoming increasingly complex, but it’s a fight we cannot afford to lose. This data leak serves as a stark reminder: the battle for online freedom is ongoing, and the stakes are higher than ever. The rise of AI-powered censorship demands our attention, our action, and our unwavering commitment to a free and open digital world. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI features.

title: Expert Says XRP Is Positioning Itself for the Future. Here’s why
body: In a recent livestream on YouTube, Versan Aljarrah and Edoardo Farina, both prominent figures in the crypto space, examined the evolving financial landscape, addressing the role of digital assets, traditional commodities, and broader economic trends. Aljarrah shared a link to the discussion on X, highlighting the impending shift in global wealth. Aljarrah believes this massive wealth transfer is happening behind closed doors as gold, silver, XRP, and others are positioning themselves for something big. Aljarrah stated, “Blockchain is going to expose the debt-based Ponzi scheme. Are you prepared for what’s ahead?” A great wealth transfer is unfolding behind closed doors where gold, silver, #XRP and other technologies are positioning themselves for the future. Blockchain is going to expose the debt based Ponzi scheme. Are you prepared for what's ahead? https://t.co/m8KFGVQyuc — Versan | Black Swan Capitalist (@VersanAljarrah) March 24, 2025 XRP and the Aftermath of the SEC Lawsuit Aljarrah and Farina analyzed XRP’s price movement following the resolution of the SEC lawsuit . They suggested that the market had already factored in the outcome, which explains the absence of a major price surge . Farina stressed that investors should prioritize the long-term utility of the XRP Ledger (XRPL) rather than short-term speculation. He expressed confidence that as utility-driven adoption grows, XRP could reach $100 or even $1,000. Farina also drew attention to comments from Ripple’s Chief Technology Officer (CTO) David Schwartz, noting that the financial system won’t be built overnight, but takes a long process, and the XRP army is watching this transformation. He noted that it could take a couple of months to see the price action the community is waiting for. Farina has consistently called on community members to accumulate XRP, recently describing selling the digital asset as throwing a winning lottery ticket away . We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Economic Instability and the Wealth Shift The discussion then expanded to the deteriorating economic conditions affecting individuals and institutions. Aljarrah and Farina pointed to rising credit card defaults, tightening lending standards, and increasing living costs as indicators of a weakening financial system. Aljarrah highlighted a trend among the wealthy, moving capital into tangible assets such as gold, silver, and natural resources. He argued that fiat currencies are deliberately devalued, forcing individuals to liquidate assets. The Role of Blockchain in the New Financial System They examined the relationship between stablecoins and CBDCs, proposing a future where a two-tier banking system incorporates asset-backed digital currencies pegged to real-world commodities. They emphasized the importance of XRP and XLM in this two-tier monetary system , referencing documents from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) regarding trust bridges , which could play a role in this transition. According to them, the existing system collapses while a new digital framework is being constructed. Digital assets like XRP and XLM, including gold and silver, will play critical roles in this transition. Disclaimer : This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice.
