title: US Congress Accelerates Crypto Oversight with New Stablecoin Bill
body: The U.S. Congress is moving forward with efforts to regulate the cryptocurrency industry, with a particular focus on stablecoins. A new stablecoin bill has been introduced in the House of Representatives, building on previous legislative efforts. This bill aims to provide clearer guidelines on how companies can issue dollar-denominated digital tokens and set the stage for broader crypto oversight. House Version of Stablecoin Bill Released The U.S. House of Representatives has moved forward in digital asset regulation efforts after it published its stablecoin bill text to the public. The two congressmen, Bryan Steil and French Hill introduced stablecoin legislation, that dictates rules for digital tokens which bind their value to the U.S. dollar. Steil who leads the Financial Services Committee crypto panel stated the bill functions to unite stablecoin legislative frameworks between the House and Senate. The legislation known as the Stablecoin Transparency and Accountability for a Better Ledger Economy (STABLE Act) follows Congress’ ongoing development of digital asset regulations. According to Hill the bill constitutes part of an extensive program to establish regulatory clarity for cryptocurrency operations. He stated that the bill aims to establish financial regulations which require stablecoin companies to maintain transparency while protecting consumers and the system. Senate Stablecoin Bill Moves Forward There has been some progress made on the regulation of stablecoins by the Senate as the bill was moved to the Banking Committee where it enjoyed bipartisan support. This bill has made its way to the Senate floor, awaiting the senate action. Rep. Representative Tom Emmer, a crypto supporter in Congress, noted that even though the two bills are somewhat similar but have distinct features, such differences are not significant and can be sorted out as the bills progressed through the legislative procedure. Lawmakers are looking forward to passing the stablecoin laws in the next few weeks especially following US President Donald Trump directive on stablecoin regulation. Emmer remained optimistic that the bill will be finished by August. This momentum is part of a wider effort in Congress to provide more stability in the regulation of cryptocurrencies so that companies and users have better frameworks to follow. Efforts to Clarify Crypto Asset Regulations Additionally, Emmer also reintroduced the Securities Clarity Act as another bill targeting how cryptocurrencies fit into the domain of securities. This bill, sponsored with republican partner Darren Soto, is to clarify legal uncertainty existing in the United States concerning the qualification of digital assets under the securities law. Emmer thus urged for better formalism saying that business requires legal predictability to the effect that they are able to conduct their operations within the legal framework. Emmer’s actions are in line with other pieces of legislation that have been made to determine how digital assets should be regulated within the U.S. financial system. These steps are regarded as crucial in offering that legal certainty that many cryptocurrencies and blockchain start-ups have claimed to need to enhance business growth and development. Wyoming and Other States Enter the Stablecoin Market As federal lawmakers push forward with stablecoin regulations, states are also taking steps to position themselves as leaders in the crypto space. Wyoming, in particular, is moving toward launching its own state-backed stablecoin . Governor Mark Gordon has announced plans to issue a stablecoin fully backed by U.S. dollar reserves, aiming to provide a fast, low-cost alternative for digital payments. The state’s move is part of a broader trend, with other companies and states working on their own stablecoin projects. Custodia and Vantage Bank, for example, recently launched the Avit stablecoin , backed by U.S. dollar reserves and based on the Ethereum blockchain. These efforts reflect the growing interest in stablecoins as a way to bridge the gap between traditional financial systems and the emerging digital economy. The post US Congress Accelerates Crypto Oversight with New Stablecoin Bill appeared first on CoinGape .

title: Crypto urges Congress to change DOJ rule used against Tornado Cash devs
body: A coalition of crypto firms has urged Congress to press the Department of Justice to amend an “unprecedented and overly expansive” interpretation of laws that were used to charge the developers of the crypto mixer Tornado Cash. A March 26 letter signed by 34 crypto companies and advocate groups sent to the Senate Banking Committee, House Financial Services Committee and the House and Senate judiciary committees said the DOJ’s take on unlicensed money-transmitting business means “essentially every blockchain developer could be prosecuted as a criminal.” The letter — led by the DeFi Education Fund and signed by the likes of Kraken and Coinbase — added that the Justice Department’s interpretation “creates confusion and ambiguity” and “threatens the viability of U.S.-based software development in the digital asset industry.” The group said the DOJ debuted its position “in August 2023 via criminal indictment” — the same time it charged Tornado Cash developers Roman Storm and Roman Semenov with money laundering. Storm has been released on bail, has pleaded not guilty and wants the charges dropped . Semenov, a Russian national, is at large. Source: DeFi Education Fund The DOJ has filed similar charges against Samourai Wallet co-founders Keonne Rodriguez and William Lonergan Hill, who have both pleaded not guilty. The crypto group’s letter argued that two sections of the US Code define a “money transmitting business” — Title 31 section 5330, defining who must be licensed and Title 18 section 1960, which criminalizes operating unlicensed. It added that 2019 guidance from the Treasury’s Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) gave examples of what money-transmitting activities and said that “if a software developer never obtains possession or control over customer funds, that developer is not operating a ‘money transmitting business.’” The letter argued that the DOJ had taken a position that the definition of a money transmitting business under section 5330 “is not relevant to determining whether someone is operating an unlicensed ‘money transmitting business’ under Section 1960” despite the “intentional similarity” in both sections and FinCEN’s guidance. Related: Hester Peirce calls for SEC rulemaking to ‘bake in’ crypto regulation The group accused the DOJ of ignoring both FinCEN’s guidance and parts of the law to pursue its own interpretation of a money-transmitting business when it charged Storm and Semenov. They said the result had seen “two separate US government agencies with conflicting interpretations of ‘money transmission’ — an unclear, unfair position for law-abiding industry participants and innovators.” The letter said that if not addressed, the Justice Department’s interpretation would expose non-custodial software developers “within the reach of the U.S. to criminal liability.” “The resulting, and very rational, fear among developers would effectively end the development of these technologies in the United States.” In January, Michael Lewellen, a fellow of the crypto advocacy group Coin Center, sued Attorney General Merrick Garland to have his planned release of non-custodial software declared legal and to block the DOJ from using money transmitting laws to prosecute him. Lewellen said the DOJ “has begun criminally prosecuting people for publishing similar cryptocurrency software,” which he claims extended the interpretation of money-transmitting laws “beyond what the Constitution allows.” Magazine: Meet lawyer Max Burwick — ‘The ambulance chaser of crypto’

title: EVAA Integrates FIVA to Unlock Fixed Yields and Leveraged Farming on TON
body: EVAA Protocol , the leading decentralized lending platform on Telegram, has announced its integration with FIVA, the first yield tokenization platform on the TON blockchain. This integration unlocks powerful new strategies for EVAA users — including fixed yields, leveraged farming, and impermanent loss-protected liquidity provision — while reaffirming EVAA’s position as the leading lending platform on TON. Think of it as Pendle meets TON — and it’s live. With this move, EVAA users can now tokenize their deposits into two distinct assets, opening up access to stable returns, amplified point farming, and composable yield strategies. This also marks the launch of FIVA’s phased mainnet rollout, with EVAA’s USDT market as its next strategic integration. One Deposit, Two Tokens — You Choose Through FIVA, EVAA depositors can split a single yield-bearing position into: PT (Principal Token): A fixed-rate instrument offering predictable income (e.g., 7–15% APY over 3–6 months) YT (Yield Token): A leveraged position offering up to 100x exposure to EVAA’s variable yields and point system — with no liquidation risk This dual-token design gives users greater control over their capital, letting them hedge risk or maximize upside depending on their strategy. Three Ways to Make Your Yield Work Smarter EVAA’s mission is to deliver transparent, sustainable, and innovative lending experiences. With FIVA now integrated, users can enhance their yield performance using three core instruments: Fixed Yields with Principal Tokens (PT) Users can lock in stable returns, ideal during times of market volatility. For example: Deposit 10,000 USDT at a fixed 7% APY over 6 months Earn 350 USDT in guaranteed returns, fully insulated from rate volatility With EVAA’s historical rates swinging between 3% and 14% — and dropping by as much as 75% in a year — PTs offer valuable protection for long-term and passive investors. This mechanism is ideal for investors who prioritize stability and need predictable income, especially in the often-volatile world of DeFi. Leveraged Farming with Yield Tokens (YT) For those seeking higher returns, YT tokens provide leveraged exposure to EVAA yields and points, with capital efficiency and capped downside. For instance, a 1,000 USDT YT position can give the yield of a 55,000 USDT deposit (representing 55x leverage – a possible scenario that varies based on market conditions) — perfect for aggressive farmers ahead of EVAA’s TGE. Multi-Stream Rewards as Liquidity Provider (LP) Users can also deploy EVAA positions to FIVA liquidity pools, earning: EVAA base yield (currently 3%) Trading fees (~0.5%) Both EVAA and FIVA points with multipliers Protection from impermanent loss at maturity Each token type — PT, YT, and LP — serves a different strategic purpose, allowing users to customize their approach based on personal risk profiles and yield targets. Phased Access, Proven Security – Rolling Out the Future of Yield The integration of FIVA into EVAA marks the start of a phased mainnet rollout designed with security, performance, and community feedback at its core. The rollout is structured across three stages: Phase 1: Early access for FIVA Genesis Pass NFT holders (completed) Phase 2: Partner access for EVAA users via exclusive links (now live) Phase 3: Full-scale expansion with additional protocol integrations (upcoming) During the current phase, EVAA users can access FIVA’s yield tokenization features through invite-only links distributed via the EVAA app, Telegram channel, quests, and partner campaigns. This controlled onboarding process allows the FIVA team to closely monitor performance, collect real-world usage data, and refine the user experience — all while ensuring protocol stability and protecting early participants. The decision to launch EVAA’s USDT market was strategic: as one of the most established protocols on TON, EVAA offers a secure and well-audited foundation to test and scale FIVA’s novel mechanics. Security remains a priority throughout. Both EVAA and FIVA implement smart contract audits, rely on Pyth oracles for reliable price feeds, and maintain contingency protections. Should any issues arise within the EVAA protocol, FIVA’s contracts are designed to honor fixed-rate positions , even if the underlying token values are affected. By combining phased access with robust security measures, the integration sets a new standard for responsible scaling in the TON DeFi space — a space that’s evolving fast and demanding smarter, safer infrastructure. And this is just the beginning. FIVA is already connected with a growing network of TON-native protocols, including Tonstakers , Storm , Ethena , and Bemo , with more integrations planned. Together with EVAA, they’re laying the groundwork for a modular DeFi ecosystem, where yield is not just earned — it’s tokenized, tradable, and optimized. Get started earning Visit the FIVA’s Telegram app or web application Connect your TON wallet Choose your strategy: Fixed yield with PT tokens Leveraged farming via YT tokens Provide liquidity to earn multiple types of rewards About EVAA & FIVA EVAA Protocol — the leading DeFi protocol built on TON, offering innovative liquidity market solutions and leveraged staking strategies. With a focus on efficiency and accessibility, EVAA enables users to borrow, stake, and reinvest seamlessly, maximizing capital utilization without compromising liquidity. The platform is integrated with Telegram, top-tier TON applications, and wallets, ensuring a frictionless experience for both institutional and retail users. Website | Twitter | Telegram | TG Community FIVA Protocol — the first yield tokenization protocol on the TON blockchain that transforms variable DeFi yields into fixed-rate products and leveraged farming positions. The protocol’s Principal and Yield Token system allows users to lock in guaranteed returns or amplify yield exposure without liquidation risk. FIVA features a specialized AMM design that protects liquidity providers from impermanent loss when held to maturity. FIVA integrates with leading TON DeFi platforms to optimize returns across stablecoins and TON assets, accessible through both web and Telegram Mini App interfaces. Website | Twitter | Telegram | TG Community

title: XRP Price Rejected at Resistance—Are Bears Taking Control?
body: XRP price started a fresh decline from the $2.50 resistance zone. The price is now recovering and might face resistance near the $2.42 level. XRP price started a fresh decline after it failed to clear the $2.50 resistance zone. The price is now trading below $2.420 and the 100-hourly Simple Moving Average. There was a break below a connecting bullish trend line with support at $2.440 on the hourly chart of the XRP/USD pair (data source from Kraken). The pair might extend losses if it breaks the $2.350 support zone. XRP Price Dips Again XRP price failed to continue higher above the $2.50 resistance zone and reacted to the downside, like Bitcoin and Ethereum . The price declined below the $2.42 and $2.40 levels. There was a break below a connecting bullish trend line with support at $2.440 on the hourly chart of the XRP/USD pair. The pair even spiked below $2.35. A low was formed at $2.329 and the price is now recovering some losses. There was a move above $2.38. The price surpassed the 23.6% Fib retracement level of the recent decline from the $2.478 swing high to the $2.329 low. The price is now trading below $2.40 and the 100-hourly Simple Moving Average. On the upside, the price might face resistance near the $2.40 level and the 50% Fib retracement level of the recent decline from the $2.478 swing high to the $2.329 low. The first major resistance is near the $2.420 level. The next resistance is $2.450. A clear move above the $2.450 resistance might send the price toward the $2.50 resistance. Any more gains might send the price toward the $2.620 resistance or even $2.6650 in the near term. The next major hurdle for the bulls might be $2.80. More Losses? If XRP fails to clear the $2.420 resistance zone, it could start another decline. Initial support on the downside is near the $2.350 level or the trend line. The next major support is near the $2.320 level. If there is a downside break and a close below the $2.320 level, the price might continue to decline toward the $2.20 support. The next major support sits near the $2.150 zone. Technical Indicators Hourly MACD – The MACD for XRP/USD is now losing pace in the bearish zone. title: Groundbreaking Wyoming Stablecoin: LayerZero Unveils Revolutionary WYST
body: Get ready for a groundbreaking development in the world of digital currency! Wyoming, known for its progressive stance on crypto, is taking a giant leap forward. They’ve just announced their partnership with LayerZero to launch WYST, the first-ever fiat-backed, fully reserved stablecoin issued by a U.S. public entity. This isn’t just another stablecoin; it’s a state-backed digital dollar poised to transform how we think about transactions. Why Wyoming is Pioneering a State-Issued Stablecoin? Wyoming has always been at the forefront of embracing blockchain technology and digital assets. Their decision to launch a state-issued stablecoin, WYST, underscores their commitment to innovation and creating a future-forward financial ecosystem. But why a stablecoin, and why now? Here are a few compelling reasons: Embracing Financial Innovation: Wyoming recognizes the immense potential of blockchain and digital currencies to streamline financial processes and enhance economic growth. Lowering Transaction Costs: Traditional financial systems often come with hefty fees and slow processing times. WYST aims to provide a low-cost, efficient alternative for global dollar transactions. Enhancing Transparency and Security: Built on blockchain, WYST promises enhanced transparency and security compared to traditional payment methods. Every transaction is recorded on a distributed ledger, making it immutable and easily auditable. Attracting Businesses and Investment: By creating a crypto-friendly environment, Wyoming aims to attract blockchain businesses and investments, fostering economic development within the state. LayerZero: The Tech Powerhouse Behind WYST The Wyoming Stable Token Commission didn’t just pick any partner; they conducted a competitive review and selected LayerZero as the token issuance partner for WYST. LayerZero’s Omnichain Fungible Token (OFT) standard stood out for its scalability and compliance with the complex requirements of operating across multiple blockchains. Let’s delve deeper into why LayerZero is the ideal choice: Omnichain Functionality: LayerZero’s OFT standard is designed for a multichain world. WYST will be available on multiple blockchains right from the start, including Ethereum, Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, Optimism, Polygon, and Solana. This broad accessibility ensures wider adoption and utility. Scalability: As Wyoming’s stablecoin gains traction, the underlying technology needs to handle increasing transaction volumes. LayerZero is built for scalability, ensuring WYST can efficiently manage growth. Compliance and Security: In the regulated world of finance, compliance is paramount. LayerZero’s technology is designed with security and regulatory compliance in mind, crucial for a state-backed stablecoin. Proven Track Record: LayerZero has established itself as a leading interoperability protocol in the blockchain space, making them a reliable partner for this ambitious project. Unpacking the Omnichain Fungible Token (OFT) Standard What exactly is the Omnichain Fungible Token (OFT) standard that makes LayerZero so suitable for WYST? In simple terms, OFT is a token standard that allows for seamless movement and functionality across different blockchains. Here’s a breakdown: Feature Description Benefit for WYST Cross-Chain Compatibility OFTs can be transferred and utilized across various blockchains. WYST can be accessed and used on multiple popular blockchains, increasing its reach and utility. Unified Liquidity Maintains liquidity across different chains, preventing fragmented markets. Ensures smooth trading and usage of WYST regardless of the blockchain being used. Simplified User Experience Users can interact with the same token across different ecosystems without complex bridging processes. Makes WYST user-friendly and accessible to a wider audience, even those less familiar with blockchain complexities. Enhanced Security Leverages LayerZero’s secure messaging protocol for cross-chain communication. Provides a robust and secure foundation for WYST transactions across different blockchains. WYST: Revolutionizing Global Dollar Transactions? The promise of WYST extends beyond just being a digital representation of the US dollar. It’s about creating a more efficient and accessible financial system. How could WYST revolutionize global dollar transactions? Faster Transactions: Blockchain transactions are significantly faster than traditional banking systems, especially for international transfers. WYST promises near-instant global dollar transfers. Lower Fees: By cutting out intermediaries and leveraging blockchain efficiency, WYST aims to drastically reduce transaction fees, making it ideal for remittances and cross-border payments. 24/7 Accessibility: Unlike traditional banking hours, blockchain networks operate 24/7. WYST will enable transactions at any time, from anywhere in the world. Financial Inclusion: Stablecoins like WYST can provide access to digital dollars for individuals in regions with limited banking infrastructure, promoting financial inclusion. What’s Next for Wyoming’s State-Issued Stablecoin? WYST is currently live on seven testnets, a crucial phase for ironing out any kinks and ensuring a smooth mainnet launch. What can we expect in the near future? Mainnet Launch: The next major step is the official launch of WYST on the mainnets of the selected blockchains. Keep an eye out for announcements regarding the official launch date. Wider Adoption: As WYST becomes available, focus will shift to driving adoption among businesses and individuals both within Wyoming and globally. Regulatory Framework: Wyoming’s proactive approach may set a precedent for other states and even the federal government to develop clear regulatory frameworks for stablecoins. Expansion and Innovation: We can expect further innovation around WYST, potentially including integration with various DeFi (Decentralized Finance) platforms and services. The Transformative Power of State-Backed Stablecoins Wyoming’s initiative is more than just launching a stablecoin; it’s about exploring the transformative power of blockchain technology to reshape financial systems. WYST could be a watershed moment, paving the way for other governmental entities to embrace digital currencies and unlock new possibilities for economic growth and efficiency. The launch of WYST is a bold step into the future of finance, showcasing how state-level initiatives can drive innovation in the cryptocurrency space. As WYST progresses from testnets to mainnet and beyond, it will be fascinating to watch its impact on global transactions and the broader adoption of digital currencies. To learn more about the latest explore our article on key developments shaping cryptocurrency institutional adoption.

title: OpenAI expects to 3X revenue in 2025 but Chinese AI firms are heating up
body: OpenAI expects to more than triple its revenue this year to $12.7 billion, despite fast-growing competition from the likes of China’s DeepSeek and other competitors making rapid progress. The ChatGPT creators also expect its revenue target for 2025 to more than double to $29.4 billion by 2026, Bloomberg reported on March 26, citing a person familiar with the matter. The 2025 estimate is a little higher than the $11.6 billion revenue target that OpenAI was reportedly eyeing for 2025, The New York Times reported last September. Bloomberg noted that the bulk of ChatGPT’s revenue has come from its paid AI software subscription offerings for consumers and businesses. OpenAI reportedly hit 1 million paid users for the corporate versions of ChatGPT last September, while the company more recently added a $200 monthly ChatGPT Pro option. The Sam Altman-led firm does not expect to be cash-flow positive until 2029, when it expects its revenue to top $125 billion, the person told Bloomberg. OpenAI is reportedly close to finalizing a $40 billion funding round led by SoftBank Group at a valuation of up to $300 billion, Bloomberg reported on March 26. The firm is also looking to convert its nonprofit business model into a for-profit venture. Competition heats up between US and Chinese AI players While the release of DeepSeek’s ChatGPT-competitor “R-1” model sent shockwaves through the AI industry in late January, it sparked a wave of several other high-quality, low-cost AI solutions from other Chinese tech firms, Bloomberg reported on March 26. Baidu Inc. launched its “Ernie X1” model to compete with DeepSeek’s R-1 model in China, while Alibaba Group launched its new open-source AI model for cost-effective AI agents on March 26. Source: David Sacks Tencent Holdings also unveiled an AI chatbot of its own under subsidiary firm Ant Group Co, while DeepSeek released its latest model — DeepSeek-V3-0324 — on March 24. Related: Cathie Wood to kick off El Salvador’s AI public education program While it remains to be seen how these Chinese models truly stack up against OpenAI’s products, the newer and often cheaper options are putting more pressure on the business models of leading US companies, Balaji Srinivasan, a tech investor and former general partner at tech-focused venture capital firm Andreessen “a16z” Horowitz said in a March 22 X post. “China is trying to do to AI what they always do: study, copy, optimize, and then bankrupt everyone with low prices and enormous scale.” Lee Kai-fu, CEO of Chinese startup 01.AI told Reuters on March 25 that DeepSeek’s efforts have positioned Chinese AI firms only three months behind their US counterparts after previously being around six to nine months behind. Source: The Short Bear Meanwhile, OpenAI’s CEO Sam Altman said on Feb. 12 that his firm is looking to ship GPT-4.5 and GPT-5 in the coming weeks or months. Plus and Pro subscribers will be able to run GPT-5 at a “higher level of intelligence” which will incorporate voice, canvas, search, deep research features and more, he said in OpenAI’s technical roadmap update. Among OpenAI’s competitors in the US market are Anthropic, DeepMind, xAI and Google’s Gemini. Magazine: What are native rollups? Full guide to Ethereum’s latest innovation

title: Ripple Integrates DIA’s Lumina for Oracle Services on the XRP Ledger
body: Blockchain infrastructure provider Ripple Labs has integrated a new data platform to provide oracle services for its decentralized, public blockchain XRP Ledger (XRPL). According to a press release shared with CryptoPotato, this oracle services provider is named Lumina and is built on the open-source financial data platform DIA (Decentralized Information Asset). Unveiling DIA’s Oracle Services Provider DIA Lumina is scheduled to go live on March 26. It will provide verifiable, trustless oracles for decentralized finance (DeFi), real-world assets (RWAs), and Web3 applications in the crypto ecosystem. DIA claims the platform will redefine the standard for oracle security, transparency, and efficiency. The financial data platform says Lumina will end “black-box data processing,” which has caused DeFi protocols and blockchain networks to rely on opaque, centralized, trust-based, and unverifiable data feeds for years. According to DIA, Lumina puts an end to an era where crypto networks are forced to depend on oracles that operate behind closed doors. Lumina offers a fully on-chain and transparent architecture that makes sure every step of the data journey is verifiable. Developers, networks, and institutions will be able to audit oracle operations directly in Lumina’s open and permissionless environment. This is why Ripple and the peer-to-peer (P2P) decentralized network Stellar have chosen DIA to provide oracle services for their blockchains. Transparency and Trustlessness Unlike other popular oracles like Chainlink and Pyth , Lumina has a fully transparent design that meets institutional and regulatory standards. Ripple believes access to fully auditable, trustless off-chain data is non-negotiable for the growth of the RWAs sector, and Lumina enables that. “For years, oracles have been considered a necessary evil by many—an infrastructure layer blockchain builders had no choice but to trust. That stops now. DIA Lumina isn’t just another oracle stack. It’s the first one that doesn’t ask you to trust it at all,” said DIA’s head of business development, Dillon Hanson. Meanwhile, Lumina’s core technology is Lasernet, a modular layer-2 rollup built for trustless and verifiable oracles. DIA says this network leverages Arbitrum’s optimistic rollup technology and Ethereum’s security to ensure oracle transactions are processed publicly and verifiably, eliminating the reliance on off-chain, multi-sig-controlled nodes. “By putting every transaction, price feed, and computation on-chain, we’re not just competing with existing oracles—we’re making them obsolete,” Hanson added. The post Ripple Integrates DIA’s Lumina for Oracle Services on the XRP Ledger appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Wyoming Plans to Launch WYST Stablecoin in July, Governor Confirms
body: The US state of Wyoming is gearing up to launch its long-standing stablecoin, WYST, in July. An official release from the state governor’s office noted that the state is considering nine blockchains to host the stablecoin. Speaking at the DC Blockchain Summit on Wednesday, Wyoming Governor Mark Gordon confirmed the token’s launch after a testing period. Wyoming has partnered with LayerZero to launch WYST, pegged to USD and backed by cash, US Treasuries and repurchase agreements. Further, the stable token maintains a statutory requirement of no less than 102% capitalization, per Bloomberg . “There’s no clearer signal of where finance is heading than a U.S. state putting the dollar onchain,” wrote LayerZero on X. We’re honored to be chosen by Wyoming as the token issuance partner for WYST, the first fiat-backed and fully-reserved stablecoin issued by a public entity in the United States. There’s no clearer signal of where finance is heading than a U.S. state putting the dollar onchain. pic.twitter.com/IkinTrmKYG — LayerZero (@LayerZero_Core) March 26, 2025 Wyoming is weighing Solana, Ethereum, Polygon, Avalanche, Base, and others among the nine potential blockchains to launch WYST. Wyoming Governor Gordon Emphasizes Stablecoin Vision Speaking at the Blockchain Summit, state Governor Mark Gordon noted that the stable token’s testing phase will continue through the second quarter. “Once launched, WYST will grant holders the ability to transmit dollar-denominated transactions of any value, anywhere in the world, nearly instantly, with significantly reduced fees compared to traditional ACH or wires,” said Wyoming Stable Token Commission Executive Director Anthony Apollo. Governor Mark highlighted the state’s “commitment to transparency and innovation” in the digital asset space. “We are thrilled to share Wyoming’s vision for state leadership in the nation’s capital,” he noted, adding that Wyoming is well-positioned as a model for other states and the federal government. “It can also be a tool that farmers and ranchers can use to develop new markets,” Gordon said. He explained how the state would generate new revenue streams from WYST through interest income derived from the reserve assets. Pro-crypto Wyoming Republican Senator Cynthia Lummis has been planning to launch a state-issued stablecoin for years. Despite her Bitcoin support, however, the Senator has harboured reservations about stablecoins like Tether. WYST Undergoes Demo Transaction Stargate, a third-party bridge powered by LayerZero, already conducted a demo transaction of WYST between Ethereum and Avalanche testnets. “The next phase of testing and customizing smart contracts is an imperative step towards delivering the best product for Wyoming and stable token holders,” said Director Apollo. The post Wyoming Plans to Launch WYST Stablecoin in July, Governor Confirms appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Urgent Senate Vote: Will Crypto Industry Win DeFi Broker Rule Showdown?
body: Get ready for round two! The U.S. Senate is back in session this evening, and crypto enthusiasts are holding their breath. After a snag in the initial vote on April 4th, senators are set to revisit the contentious DeFi broker rule. This regulation, aimed at bringing decentralized finance (DeFi) under traditional financial reporting frameworks, has sparked significant opposition from the crypto community. Will this second vote finally overturn the rule? Let’s dive into what’s happening and what it means for the future of crypto. What is the DeFi Broker Rule and Why the Fuss? At the heart of this legislative battle is the DeFi broker rule . This rule, proposed by regulatory bodies, mandates that entities operating as brokers in the decentralized finance space must report the total proceeds from digital asset sales. Sounds simple enough, right? Not quite. The crypto industry argues this rule is deeply flawed and impractical for several key reasons: Defining a ‘Broker’ in DeFi is Murky: DeFi is built on decentralization. There aren’t always clear intermediaries in the way traditional finance operates. Identifying who qualifies as a ‘broker’ in a decentralized, often anonymous environment is incredibly complex and potentially overbroad. Privacy Concerns: The reporting requirements could compromise the privacy of DeFi users, a core tenet of many cryptocurrency principles. Forcing platforms to collect and report user data goes against the ethos of decentralization and could stifle innovation. Technical Challenges: Implementing such reporting requirements in the decentralized world presents immense technical hurdles. DeFi protocols are often designed to be permissionless and operate without central control, making data collection and reporting a significant challenge. Innovation Stifling: Many in the crypto space fear that overly burdensome regulations like the DeFi broker rule could stifle innovation and drive developers and businesses away from the U.S., pushing the burgeoning DeFi sector offshore. Essentially, the crypto industry views the DeFi broker rule as a square peg being forced into a round hole – traditional financial regulations being clumsily applied to a fundamentally different technological paradigm. The industry argues for a more nuanced and tailored approach to regulation that acknowledges the unique characteristics of DeFi. The Senate Vote: A Second Chance for Crypto? The fact that the Senate is holding a second vote on overturning the DeFi broker rule is significant. It indicates that the initial attempt, while facing a technical hurdle, has garnered enough support to warrant another try. According to reports from Eleanor Terrett, a procedural vote is scheduled for 5 p.m. this evening, followed by a final passage vote expected around 8 p.m. Eastern Time. This timeline suggests a focused and determined effort to push this resolution through. Why is this Senate vote so crucial? Industry-Wide Impact: The outcome of this vote will have a ripple effect across the entire crypto industry. Overturning the rule would be seen as a major victory, signaling a more accommodating regulatory environment in the U.S., encouraging further investment and development in the crypto space. Setting a Precedent: This vote could set a precedent for future crypto regulations. If the Senate successfully repeals the DeFi broker rule, it might embolden lawmakers to take a more cautious and considered approach to regulating digital assets, engaging with the industry and understanding its nuances. Global Signal: The U.S.’s stance on crypto regulation is closely watched globally. A move to overturn the DeFi broker rule could send a positive signal to the international crypto community, positioning the U.S. as a more crypto-friendly nation. What Happens Next? Potential Scenarios Let’s consider the potential outcomes of this pivotal Senate vote and what they could mean: Scenario Likelihood Impact on Crypto Industry Senate Repeals DeFi Broker Rule (Again) High (Given second vote attempt) Positive: Crypto industry celebrates a significant regulatory victory. Increased investment, innovation, and potentially clearer regulatory pathways in the U.S. Senate Fails to Repeal DeFi Broker Rule Medium (Possible resistance remains) Negative: Disappointment in the crypto industry. Concerns about overregulation and potential stifling of DeFi innovation in the U.S. May lead to increased focus on offshore DeFi development. Resolution Moves to President Trump Dependent on Senate outcome Uncertain: Trump’s stance on crypto regulation is evolving. His administration’s final decision would be crucial. Industry hopes for a favorable outcome given Trump’s generally pro-business stance. Crypto Regulation: A Constant Balancing Act The debate surrounding the DeFi broker rule highlights the ongoing tension between regulation and innovation in the cryptocurrency space. Governments worldwide are grappling with how to regulate this nascent industry effectively. The challenge lies in finding a balance that protects consumers and prevents illicit activities without suffocating the potential for growth and technological advancement that crypto offers. Key Challenges in Crypto Regulation: Rapid Technological Evolution: The crypto space is constantly evolving. Regulations need to be adaptable and forward-thinking to keep pace with technological advancements. Decentralization and Anonymity: The decentralized and pseudonymous nature of many cryptocurrencies poses unique challenges for traditional regulatory frameworks designed for centralized and transparent systems. Global Nature of Crypto: Crypto operates globally, transcending national borders. Effective regulation requires international cooperation and coordination to prevent regulatory arbitrage and ensure consistent standards. Education and Understanding: Policymakers and regulators need to develop a deeper understanding of the technology and its nuances to create informed and effective regulations. Digital Asset Sales: What’s at Stake? The core of the DeFi broker rule controversy revolves around the reporting of digital asset sales . For the crypto industry, this isn’t just about compliance; it’s about the fundamental principles of how digital assets are treated and regulated. Requiring DeFi brokers to report total proceeds from digital asset sales raises questions about: Definition of ‘Sale’: In DeFi, transactions can be complex and involve various forms of exchange, staking, lending, and borrowing. Defining what constitutes a ‘sale’ for reporting purposes can be ambiguous and problematic. Data Collection and Reporting Burden: The sheer volume and velocity of transactions in DeFi networks could make the reporting burden overwhelming and technically infeasible for many platforms. Impact on Market Liquidity: Overly stringent reporting requirements could reduce liquidity in DeFi markets if platforms and users become hesitant to engage in transactions due to compliance concerns. Ultimately, the debate over reporting digital asset sales in DeFi is about striking a balance between regulatory oversight and fostering a thriving, innovative digital economy. The Crypto Industry Impact: Watching with Bated Breath The entire crypto industry impact is keenly observing the Senate’s second vote. This isn’t just about one rule; it’s about the broader regulatory climate in the United States and its implications for the future of crypto innovation. A successful repeal would be a shot in the arm for the industry, signaling that policymakers are listening to concerns and are willing to take a more balanced approach to regulation. Potential Positive Impacts of Rule Repeal: Boost to Investor Confidence: A more favorable regulatory environment could attract more institutional and retail investors to the crypto market. Increased DeFi Adoption: Reduced regulatory uncertainty could encourage wider adoption of DeFi protocols and applications. Job Creation and Economic Growth: A thriving crypto industry can create new jobs and contribute significantly to economic growth in the U.S. Innovation Hub: A supportive regulatory framework can position the U.S. as a global hub for crypto innovation and development. Final Thoughts: A Pivotal Moment for Crypto The Senate’s second vote on the DeFi broker rule is more than just a procedural step; it’s a pivotal moment for the cryptocurrency industry. The outcome will send a strong message about the U.S.’s approach to crypto regulation and its willingness to foster innovation in this transformative space. As the crypto world waits with anticipation, the decisions made in the Senate this evening could significantly shape the future trajectory of decentralized finance and the broader digital asset ecosystem. To learn more about the latest crypto regulation trends, explore our article on key developments shaping crypto policy and compliance.

title: Hopeful Clarity: SEC Nominee Atkins Promises Clear Crypto Guidelines
body: The cryptocurrency world is buzzing with anticipation as Paul Atkins, President Trump’s pick for SEC Chair, has publicly committed to establishing clear and principled digital asset regulations. This news comes as a beacon of hope for many in the crypto space who have long yearned for regulatory certainty. But what exactly does this mean for the future of crypto, and why is Atkins’ nomination such a significant development? Let’s dive into the details of his pledge and explore what it could entail for the evolving world of digital currencies. Why Clear Crypto Guidelines Matter? For years, the cryptocurrency industry has navigated a complex and often ambiguous regulatory landscape. This lack of clarity has been a major pain point, hindering innovation and creating uncertainty for businesses and investors alike. Imagine trying to build a house without knowing the building codes – that’s been the reality for many crypto ventures. Clear crypto guidelines are not just about ticking boxes; they are about fostering a healthy and thriving ecosystem. Here’s why they are so crucial: Reduced Market Uncertainty: Ambiguity breeds volatility. When regulations are unclear, market participants are unsure of the rules of the game, leading to hesitant investment and potential market instability. Clear guidelines provide a stable foundation, encouraging confidence and long-term growth. Fostering Innovation: Innovation thrives in environments where the boundaries are defined, not absent. Knowing the regulatory parameters allows crypto companies to innovate within a framework, rather than constantly fearing unforeseen legal hurdles. This clarity can unlock a wave of new products and services in the digital asset space. Attracting Institutional Investment: Large institutional investors, who could inject significant capital into the crypto market, often shy away due to regulatory uncertainty. Clear rules can pave the way for greater institutional participation, bringing much-needed liquidity and maturity to the market. Investor Protection (Yes, it’s crucial!): While some fear regulation stifles growth, thoughtful regulation is paramount for investor protection . Clear guidelines can help prevent scams, fraud, and market manipulation, ensuring a safer environment for everyone involved. Who is Paul Atkins, the SEC Chair Nominee? Paul Atkins isn’t a newcomer to the world of securities regulation. He brings a wealth of experience to the table, having served as an SEC Commissioner from 2002 to 2008. This prior experience within the agency provides him with a deep understanding of the SEC’s workings and its mandate. Currently, he leads Patomak Global Partners, a regulatory consulting firm. His background suggests a pragmatic and informed approach to regulation. As SEC Chair nominee , his words carry significant weight, signaling a potential shift in the regulatory approach towards digital assets. Atkins’ Pledge: Principled and Clear Crypto Regulations During his appearance before the Senate Banking Committee , Atkins didn’t just vaguely mention crypto regulation. He specifically vowed to establish “clear and principled digital asset regulations” if confirmed. This is a strong statement of intent. He emphasized the need for “coherent rules” to reduce market uncertainty and, crucially, to foster innovation. This balanced approach – promoting both clarity and innovation – is being welcomed by many in the crypto community. Atkins further outlined his priorities, which include: Investor Protection First: He stressed that protecting investors would be a top priority. This aligns with the SEC’s core mission and is a reassuring message for those concerned about the risks in the crypto market. Depoliticizing Securities Oversight: Atkins aims to remove political bias from the SEC’s oversight, suggesting a focus on objective, rule-based decision-making. This could lead to more predictable and consistent regulatory actions. Smart, Tailored Regulation: He advocated for regulation that is “smart” and “tailored” to the specific nuances of the digital asset space, operating within the SEC’s existing authority. This implies a move away from a one-size-fits-all approach and towards regulations that are fit for purpose. The Crypto Investments Controversy: A Hurdle to Overcome? Atkins’ nomination hasn’t been entirely smooth sailing. It has faced delays due to scrutiny over his financial disclosures, particularly concerning his crypto investments . Reports indicate these investments could be as high as $6 million. This has raised questions about potential conflicts of interest. However, Atkins has taken a proactive step, agreeing to divest these holdings if he is confirmed as SEC Chair. This commitment to divestiture attempts to address these concerns and clear the path for his confirmation. The Senate Banking Committee’s approval is the next hurdle, followed by a full Senate vote. The timeline remains uncertain, but the crypto industry is watching closely, hoping for a swift and positive outcome. The potential for clear crypto guidelines under Atkins’ leadership is seen as a significant positive development. What to Expect if Atkins is Confirmed? If Paul Atkins is confirmed as SEC Chair, the cryptocurrency industry can likely anticipate a more defined and structured regulatory environment. While the specifics of these regulations remain to be seen, his statements suggest a focus on: Area Potential Impact Digital Asset Classifications Clearer definitions of what constitutes a security versus other types of digital assets, reducing ambiguity and legal uncertainty. ICO/Token Sales More defined rules for Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) and token sales, potentially making it easier for legitimate projects to raise capital compliantly. Crypto Exchanges and Custodians Potentially clearer guidelines for the operation and regulation of cryptocurrency exchanges and custodial services, enhancing investor protection and market integrity. Enforcement Actions While aiming for clarity, the SEC under Atkins may also be expected to take enforcement actions against bad actors in the crypto space to maintain market integrity and protect investors. It’s important to remember that regulatory frameworks take time to develop and implement. Even with Atkins at the helm, the process will likely be gradual and involve consultation with industry stakeholders. However, his commitment to clarity is a significant first step and signals a potentially more constructive and innovation-friendly approach from the SEC. Conclusion: A Glimmer of Hope for Crypto Regulation? Paul Atkins’ nomination and his pledge for clear crypto guidelines represent a potentially pivotal moment for the cryptocurrency industry. His experience, coupled with his stated commitment to principled and smart regulation, offers a glimmer of hope for a more stable and predictable future for digital assets. While challenges remain, and the Senate confirmation process is still underway, the prospect of clearer rules is undoubtedly a positive signal for the crypto market. The industry waits with bated breath to see if this promise of clarity will translate into a regulatory framework that fosters both innovation and investor protection, paving the way for the next phase of crypto’s evolution. title: Frustrating Delay: ChatGPT’s Exciting AI Image Feature Held Back for Free Users
body: The buzz around ChatGPT’s groundbreaking AI image generation capabilities has been palpable, and for good reason! The promise of creating stunning visuals directly within your chat interface was incredibly exciting. However, if you’re a free ChatGPT user eagerly awaiting this feature, there’s some disappointing news. OpenAI has announced a delay in rolling out this fantastic tool to free users. Let’s dive into why this delay has occurred and what it means for you. Why the Delay in ChatGPT’s AI Image Generation for Free Users? OpenAI CEO Sam Altman himself broke the news, citing unexpectedly high demand as the primary reason for the delay . In a post on X, Altman stated that the “Images in ChatGPT are wayyyy more popular than we expected (and we had pretty high expectations).” This surge in popularity has seemingly overwhelmed OpenAI’s current infrastructure, leading to the decision to postpone the rollout for free users. Think of it like a viral product launch – everyone wants it at once, and the servers are struggling to keep up! Here’s a breakdown of the situation: Overwhelming Demand: The AI image feature has become an instant hit, exceeding even OpenAI’s optimistic projections. Capacity Constraints: OpenAI is facing limitations in its current computing capacity to handle the massive influx of users wanting to generate images. Prioritizing Paid Users: Currently, the feature has only been launched for ChatGPT Pro, Plus, and Teams subscribers. This suggests a prioritization of paying customers to ensure a smooth experience for them, while free users will have to wait. What Does This Delay Mean for Free ChatGPT Users and AI Image Generation Access? For millions of free ChatGPT users who were looking forward to experimenting with AI image generation , this delay is undoubtedly a setback. It means you’ll have to wait longer to access this innovative feature directly within ChatGPT. While it’s disappointing, it’s important to understand the context and potential reasons behind this decision. Here’s what you should consider: Limited Access for Now: The AI image feature is currently exclusive to paid subscribers. If you’re keen to use it immediately, upgrading to ChatGPT Plus or Pro might be an option. Patience is Key: OpenAI hasn’t provided a specific timeline for when the feature will be available to free users. However, Altman’s statement suggests they are working on addressing the capacity issues. Alternative Options: In the meantime, there are other AI image generation tools available online, such as DALL-E 2 (also from OpenAI, but accessible separately), Midjourney, and Stable Diffusion. You can explore these alternatives while waiting for the ChatGPT feature to become available. Is OpenAI’s Infrastructure Prepared for the Future of AI? This isn’t the first time OpenAI has faced capacity-related challenges. Remember the Sora launch in December? Sign-ups were quickly disabled due to similar issues. These recurring hiccups raise questions about whether OpenAI’s infrastructure is adequately prepared for the rapid growth and adoption of its AI technologies. However, there’s a glimmer of hope on the horizon. OpenAI’s ambitious $500 billion “Stargate” data center project could be the long-term solution to these capacity constraints. This massive investment signals OpenAI’s commitment to scaling its infrastructure to meet the ever-increasing demands of its AI models and user base. Stargate, if successful, promises to provide the robust computing power needed to support features like ChatGPT ‘s image generation and future AI innovations. Navigating the Wait for Free AI Image Generation in ChatGPT While the delay of AI image generation for free users is frustrating, it also highlights the immense popularity and potential of these technologies. OpenAI is clearly grappling with the challenges of scaling its services to meet this unprecedented demand. For now, free users will need to exercise patience. Keep an eye on official OpenAI announcements and tech news outlets for updates on when this exciting feature will finally become accessible to everyone. In the meantime, explore alternative AI image generators, or consider if upgrading to a paid ChatGPT plan aligns with your needs. The future of AI is undoubtedly visual, and while there’s a temporary hurdle, the path forward promises incredible creative possibilities. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI features.

title: 20% of Top Korean Officials Own Millions In Crypto Assets: Report
body: The post 20% of Top Korean Officials Own Millions In Crypto Assets: Report appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News As per a recent disclosure , a report by the Korean government’s Public Officials Ethics Committee shows that a significant number of public officials are embracing cryptocurrency. On 27th March, the Korean government’s Public Officials Ethics Committee released the regular updates on public officials’ assets for 2025. According to the Korean Cultural Daily, 411 out of 2,047 public officials (about 20.1%) hold cryptocurrency, with a total value of 14.4 billion won (around $9.8 million). Notably, two out of 10 high-ranking public officials held virtual assets and the average holding per person was found to be 35.07 million won. Seoul City Councilor Kim Hye-young Tops The List Among them, Seoul City Councilor Kim Hye-young tops the list, with an impressive 1.7 billion won, which is about $1.27 million in Digital assets. Council Member Kim owns 16 types of cryptocurrencies, including 0.00144591 Bitcoin. Additionally, her spouse and eldest son also hold ETH, DOGE, and XRP. She reported holding 0.01226935 Ethereum, around 472 Dogecoins, and approximately 519,004 Ripples, along with about 3,336 Ripples owned by her eldest son. Seoul City Councilor Choi Min-gyu stood second with a reported 1.62 billion KRW in virtual assets, including nearly 410,000 Ripples and thousands of Artidiums and Ads. Close behind is, Kim Ki-hwan, CEO of Busan-Ulsan Expressway, with 1.43 billion KRW in crypto, holding over 150,000 Luna Classics and a range of other altcoins. Growing Trend of Government Officials Investing In Crypto Besides, several high-ranking public officials including Kim Dae-hwan, Oh Moon-kyo, and Park Byeong-chun, have significant cryptocurrency holdings. These officials are part of the top 10, with assets ranging from KRW 270 million to over KRW 1.3 billion. The disclosure of their crypto assets follows new regulations requiring public officials to report their holdings. This marks a growing trend of government figures investing in virtual currencies, highlighting a shift in how traditional officials are engaging with the evolving financial landscape. The involvement of public officials in cryptocurrency has sparked both interest and debate. In South Korea, the government’s move to mandate the disclosure of public officials’ cryptocurrency holdings aims to enhance transparency and accountability. Conflict of Interest In the U.S., some officials, including President Trump, have shown interest in cryptocurrencies, with Trump proposing a Bitcoin reserve to boost financial innovation. However, this involvement has raised some concerns ove conflicts of interest. Trump’s involvement in the crypto space has also drawn criticism, with his family’s ties to World Liberty Financial and the launch of a memecoin in January raising concerns about close connections between the administration and the crypto industry.

title: BNB Price Eyes Upside—Key Levels to Watch for a Breakout
body: BNB price is recovering from the $600 support zone. The price is rising and might aim for a fresh move toward the $640 resistance. BNB price is moving higher above the $620 resistance zone. The price is now trading below $630 and the 100-hourly simple moving average. There is a connecting bearish trend line forming with resistance at $627 on the hourly chart of the BNB/USD pair (data source from Binance). The pair must stay above the $615 level to start another increase in the near term. BNB Price Eyes Upside Break After forming a base above the $600 level, BNB price started a fresh increase. There was a move above the $618 and $610 resistance levels. It even recovered above the $625 level, like Ethereum and Bitcoin . There was a break above the 23.6% Fib retracement level of the downward move from the $645 swing high to the $615 low. The price is now trading below $630 and the 100-hourly simple moving average. On the upside, the price could face resistance near the $628 level. There is also a connecting bearish trend line forming with resistance at $627 on the hourly chart of the BNB/USD pair. The next resistance sits near the $630 level or the 50% Fib retracement level of the downward move from the $645 swing high to the $615 low. A clear move above the $630 zone could send the price higher. In the stated case, BNB price could test $638. A close above the $638 resistance might set the pace for a larger move toward the $650 resistance. Any more gains might call for a test of the $665 level in the near term. Another Decline? If BNB fails to clear the $630 resistance, it could start another decline. Initial support on the downside is near the $622 level. The next major support is near the $615 level. The main support sits at $600. If there is a downside break below the $600 support, the price could drop toward the $585 support. Any more losses could initiate a larger decline toward the $565 level. Technical Indicators Hourly MACD – The MACD for BNB/USD is gaining pace in the bullish zone. Hourly RSI (Relative Strength Index) – The RSI for BNB/USD is currently above the 50 level. Major Support Levels – $622 and $615. Major Resistance Levels – $628 and $630.

title: Trump’s SEC Pick Atkins Pitches ‘Rational, Coherent’ Crypto Policy in Confirmation Bid
body: Paul Atkins, President Donald Trump’s nominee to chair the US Securities and Exchange Commission, signaled a sharp shift in the agency’s regulatory posture on Wednesday, vowing to implement a “rational, coherent, and principled” framework for digital assets. His remarks, released in prepared testimony ahead of Thursday’s Senate confirmation hearing, position Atkins as a crypto-friendly regulator seeking to rein in what he described as burdensome and overly politicized oversight. Atkins, who previously served as an SEC commissioner under President George W. Bush, criticized the agency’s approach to crypto regulation under the Biden admin, calling it “ambiguous and non-existent” and a barrier to innovation. “Since 2017, as I have led industry efforts to develop best practices for the digital asset industry, I have seen how ambiguous and non-existent regulations for digital assets create uncertainty in the market and inhibit innovation,” he said. SEC Poised for Policy Overhaul as Atkins Pledges Pro-Growth Crypto Framework In his testimony, Atkins pledged to work alongside fellow commissioners and lawmakers to establish clear rules that foster innovation while protecting investors. U.S. SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION CHAIR NOMINEE PAUL ATKINS PLEDGES TO PROVIDE 'RATIONAL, COHERENT AND PRINCIPLED' APPROACH TO CRYPTO REGULATION -TESTIMONY — *Walter Bloomberg (@DeItaone) March 26, 2025 “It is time to reset priorities and return common sense to the SEC,” he added, arguing that excessive regulation has stifled capital formation and confused retail investors with overly complex disclosures. The confirmation hearing comes as the SEC begins reassessing its stance on digital assets under a new administration. Since January, the Trump White House has issued several pro-crypto executive orders and is actively working to roll back regulations adopted under former SEC Chair Gary Gensler. Paul Atkins Holds Up to $6M in Crypto-Related Assets, Faces Questions Over FTX Ties Atkins enters the confirmation process with notable financial ties to the crypto sector. In an ethics filing released Tuesday, he disclosed up to $6m in crypto-related investments , including equity stakes in Anchorage Digital and tokenization platform Securitize. He also reported between $1m and $5m in the crypto investment fund Off the Chain Capital, where he is a limited partner. While none of the holdings include Bitcoin, the disclosure highlights Atkins’ deep exposure to the industry he may soon be charged with regulating. Together with his wife, Sarah Humphreys, Atkins reported total assets of up to $327m, mostly derived from his consulting firm Patomak Global Partners and her family’s business, Tamko Building Products. The couple’s combined holdings could exceed $588m based on upper-range estimates. But Atkins’ nomination has already drawn fire from Senate Democrats. Sen. Elizabeth Warren, a longtime crypto skeptic, has demanded clarity on his ties to collapsed exchange FTX , which is listed as a creditor of Patomak in bankruptcy filings. In a letter this week, Warren urged Atkins to explain his advisory work and how he would avoid conflicts of interest in overseeing digital asset markets. The post Trump’s SEC Pick Atkins Pitches ‘Rational, Coherent’ Crypto Policy in Confirmation Bid appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Bitcoin And Altcoin News: 3 Reasons Markets May Be Turning Bearish
body: The post Bitcoin And Altcoin News: 3 Reasons Markets May Be Turning Bearish appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The cryptocurrency market is currently stuck in a range, with Bitcoin still attempting to rise above the crucial $90k mark. Meanwhile, the majority of altcoins are trying to recover from recent losses . Experts are noticing an interesting shift, as altcoins begin to break trends and take the lead. For months, Bitcoin was the dominant force, but as it slowed down, altcoins started to drive the market’s correction. However, Matt Bartolini, head of SPDR Americas Research at State Street Global Advisors, recently discussed risks facing the markets, especially in light of the current economic climate. Here are three key reasons why markets may be turning bearish: Weakened Consumer Confidence : Consumer confidence dropped to its lowest point since 2021, hitting 92.9 in March. This suggests that Americans are feeling uneasy about the economy, and if spending slows down, it could hurt the market, especially in the consumer sector. Consumer discretionary stocks in the S&P 500 are down 9% this year, compared to a 2% decline in the overall market. Bearish Positioning in Consumer Discretionary : There are signs of a bearish outlook in the consumer discretionary sector, with $800 million in outflows in March alone. Options data also shows a higher number of puts compared to calls, and short interest is rising. A lot of this bearish sentiment comes from poor performance in stocks like Tesla and broader economic factors. .article-inside-link { margin-left: 0 !important; border: 1px solid #0052CC4D; border-left: 0; border-right: 0; padding: 10px 0; text-align: left; } .entry ul.article-inside-link li { font-size: 14px; line-height: 21px; font-weight: 600; list-style-type: none; margin-bottom: 0; display: inline-block; } .entry ul.article-inside-link li:last-child { display: none; } Also Read : Four Reasons Why XRP Price May Hit $20 Soon , Uncertainty in Economic Data : Worries over inflation and weak economic data, like GDP forecasts from the Atlanta Fed, are also affecting market sentiment. title: Hyperliquid JELLY Manipulation Breakdown: How a 500% Pump Nearly Cost $12M
body: The post Hyperliquid JELLY Manipulation Breakdown: How a 500% Pump Nearly Cost $12M appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Hyperliquid, a decentralized exchange , faced a big problem when the price of meme coin JELLYJELLY suddenly jumped by 500%. It looked like someone was manipulating the market, putting the exchange at risk of losing $12 million. But before things got worse, Hyperliquid’s team stepped in, fixed the issue, and turned the loss into a $700K profit. To stop any more trouble, they shut down trading for JELLYJELLY. How One Whale Nearly Broke the System The chaos started when a trader holding 124.6 million JELLYJELLY tokens, worth $4.5 million, placed an $8 million short bet on Hyperliquid. This forced the platform’s liquidity vault to take on the risk. But then, another wallet likely controlled by the same trader opened a massive long position at the same time. This caused JELLYJELLY’s price to skyrocket, leading to mass liquidations and huge profits for the trader. Arkham later revealed that this was a deliberate strategy to exploit leverage and drain funds from Hyperliquid. Hyperliquid just got exploited. What happened? A trader deposited $7.167M on 3 separate Hyperliquid accounts within 5 minutes of each other. He then made leveraged trades on an illiquid coin, JELLYJELLY. However, he ended up losing money, and is down almost $1M unless… pic.twitter.com/uNyMwLS5Sc — Arkham (@arkham) March 26, 2025 But the plan backfired when the trader’s accounts were restricted to reduce-only orders. This meant they could no longer open new trades and had to start selling off tokens from the first account to recover some of their funds, despite still having millions in unrealized gains. The attacker’s last withdrawal was at 12:43 UTC. However, he continued to attempt withdrawals – but was unable to, since his account was restricted to reduce-only orders at 12:50 UTC. However, his accounts still had millions of dollars in unrealized PnL. Instead of withdrawing,… pic.twitter.com/T9XcL35rCr — Arkham (@arkham) March 26, 2025 As JELLYJELLY’s price kept climbing, Hyperliquid’s liquidity vault faced the risk of a massive wipeout. If the token’s market cap kept rising, the vault could have lost everything. Seeing the surge in trading, major exchanges like Binance and OKX stepped in, listing perpetual futures for JELLYJELLY to capitalize on the hype. Hyperliquid Pulls the Plug With the situation escalating, Hyperliquid validators stepped in and reset JELLYJELLY’s price to $0.0095—the level where the whale had originally placed their short position. This allowed the platform to liquidate 392 million JELLYJELLY tokens, converting a multi-million-dollar disaster into a manageable $703K profit. However, to prevent further manipulation, Hyperliquid immediately closed all open JELLYJELLY positions and removed the token from its platform. The team also promised to reimburse affected users, with compensation set to be distributed automatically, except for flagged addresses suspected of being involved in the scheme. A Blow to Hyperliquid’s Reputation? Hyperliquid’s response to the crisis drew mixed reactions. Some praised its quick action, while critics like Bitget CEO Gracy Chen argued it acted more like a centralized exchange. BitMEX co-founder Arthur Hayes also questioned the handling of the situation. This marks Hyperliquid’s second major liquidity scare in just two weeks. Earlier, a whale’s $200 million Ethereum long liquidation caused a $4 million loss for its liquidity vault. The repeated turmoil has shaken confidence, sending Hyperliquid’s native token, HYPE, down over 12% in a day and over 30% for the month. .article_register_shortcode { padding: 18px 24px; border-radius: 8px; display: flex; align-items: center; margin: 6px 0 22px; border: 1px solid #0052CC4D; background: linear-gradient(90deg, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1) 0%, rgba(0, 82, 204, 0.1) 100%); } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 { color: #000000; font-weight: 600; font-size: 20px; line-height: 22px; text-align:left; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 span { color: #0052CC; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px; line-height: 22px; color: #171717B2; margin-top: 4px; text-align:left; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body{ padding-right: 14px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-button a { float: right; } .article_register_shortcode .primary-button img{ vertical-align: middle; width: 20px; margin: 0; display: inline-block; } @media (min-width: 581px) and (max-width: 991px) { .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { margin-bottom: 0; } } @media (max-width: 580px) { .article_register_shortcode { display: block; padding: 20px; } .article_register_shortcode img { max-width: 50px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 { font-size: 16px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body { margin-left: 0px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { font-size: 13px; line-height: 20px; margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 14px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-button a { float: unset; } .article_register_shortcode .secondary-button { margin-bottom: 0; } } Never Miss a Beat in the Crypto World!
